Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Certainly. Here is the translation:
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, children of wisdom, I have come to you to complete this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, because of your faith in me, and for your experiences, and for your declarations, it is clear to me that you must understand this treatise, which is a part of my art, so to speak.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For our region and our time, surgery is a dangerous art, so that the science of it is in great danger; its vision is in its decline; and it does not remain among us except for a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which change the most and bring about those errors and ignorance that arise from the lack of understanding of its principles and the increase of its power and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	I believe that I have composed this treatise in such a way as to order the sayings and the declarations and the abbreviations; and that it is for the purpose of adding to the forms of the instruments of cautery and other instruments of the work as well as for the addition of the declaration and the preparation of it, which is necessary
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why one does not find a good surgeon in our time is that the art of medicine is long, and that it includes many actors who must exercise their skill in the science of anatomy, which Gualia knows well, since she knows the structure of the limbs and their forms, and their union and separation; and she has knowledge of bones, nerves, and lacerations, and of their number, and of their color; and of the pulsating veins and the quietness of their place.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And thus says Hippocrates that he who has no name is not a man, and in small works and more in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Indeed, as we said at the beginning of this book, he seen many of those who learn anatomy but do not learn it in the way that will save lives; for these are the ones who are formed in this science and depart from it by means of this science and by experiment
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen a foolish doctor who, having incised an abscess of the scrotum in the groin of a woman, has incised several arteries of the groin so that a great amount of blood flows out, and the woman died between her legs.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another doctor who took a stone from a man who had had it for a long time, and the stone was great, and when he brought it to me, I cut out that stone with a piece of the bladder, and on the third day the man died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I have already told you that in such a case, when the stone is great and the patient’s condition is bad, we must know that he will die
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	I have seen another doctor who was taking care of a duke from our land for surgery, and he caused a black slave who was his servant to break his thigh in the patient’s groin; and in his ignorance the doctor, having fractured the bone, closed the wound with silk and thread of strong structure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Then I dismissed them according to their desires, and I bound him, and I left him for five days and commanded that they remove the dressing; and thus the wound festered until the bone was completely exposed and the patient died.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	I went back and found that they had taken off the dressing, and there was peace and the patient was relieved of his pain
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, corruption was already confirmed in the limb, for I could not restrain it, and I did not cease to spread corruption in the limb until the patient was in danger of death.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	I have seen another doctor who performed an operation for cancer of the kidney, and caused ulcers nearby in a few days, so that the malice of the disease grew greater in the master of the house
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is that black bile is pure melancholy, which does not suffice to drive out the humour from the whole body, but that it should be applied to the limb which suffers so that the whole body becomes host to the rest
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And thus, children, you must know that the art of surgery must be divided into two divisions: that which is associated with health, and that which is dangerous in the greatest conditions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already spoken of this in many places in this book where I have discussed the error and fear of surgery; for you must know that it is necessary for you to preserve this and leave that, so that the fools do not find fault with you and you do not suffer for it
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore take the sacred arms in the request and in the protection of God, and the wicked diseases in the facility and in the firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And thus, through the goodness of God, we have reached salvation and a blessed succession, and we have laid low the terrible diseases that are difficult to heal, and we have overcome the rest of the weapons of that which you fear, so that you may rejoice in your faith and in your name, for your merit rests with your glory, and more so in heaven and behind the rest of the saints.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Indeed, I have already mentioned several times:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“There is no cure for a bad disease, so that no doctor shall be called by that name”.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already had to deliver this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is arranged of the head inwards of the foot, in the forms of the instruments and in the instruments of the cautery, and of what is necessary in the operation
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of swelling and perforation, and of blisters, and of wounds, and of the extraction of arrows and similar to these, all capitulated and arranged of the forms of the instruments
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and dislocation, and of treatment of twist and similar to these; chapter arranged from the head inwards of the foot, and of the forms of the instruments
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	From cautery with fire and acute medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that one begins the treatise of all the book
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Since I have said what is the quality of the instruments of that cautery and of the documents of them, and in what combination it is prohibited to cauterize
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the word concerning the quality of the instruments of the cautery and of the document is a long and laborious one, and subtle for science, and a secret hidden; and already many savants have spoken of it, and they have disagreed with each other, and I am content with a small part of their sermons, fearing too much extension
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Therefore I say that the cautery conforms to all the universal completion that is in matter or its matter, except for two completions, which are caudal completions of its matter
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the caudal and dry completion I matter disagree; for some say that the cautery is useful for that, and others say that it is harmful for that, because the nature of the fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that the disease be both cold and dry with that which is cauterized and dry so that it is healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I say that whoever says the opposite, that for the cautery is useful in every cold and dry disease that appears in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of a man with the humidity of the air with the completion of the fire, you find the body of a man cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say concerning this word that I have already experienced it several times in my practice
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	May be, however, I do not say that it should be spoken of that which has already been exposed and exercised in the chapter of the cautery after exercise, and to know the diversity of the humors of men and the situation of diseases in their places, and the causes of these, and the accidents of these, and the space of time of these.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	May be in the other completions, it is not about you to fear, and more so in the cold and wet diseases, for already all the doctors have agreed on that, and they do not disagree in the usefulness of the cautery in these
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you know, children, that the secret of the treatment of the cautery with fire and of the goodness of it, is about the cautery with burning medicine, for the fire is simple, the action of which does not reach beyond the member to which it is cauterized and does not notice the other member with it adjusted except for a small document
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	For the action of the burning medicine reaches only to that in the member from which it is exhaled, and it makes very strong that the disease in the member is of difficult healing and makes it very strong that it is useful.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	For the fire, for its subtlety and its preciousness, does nothing but flow and we already know by experience and by the length of our service in the art concerning the truth of the causes; and for this reason I am excused for the length of this discourse, for it is not legible to me in this place in this time the secret which is hidden with fire, and the quality of the operation of the fire in the bodies and the expulsion of the disease by it, which is demonstrated in philosophical terms, which would be acute in the following days.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Indeed, children, I have learned that the most opportune time for cautery is when the weather is mildest in the springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, for so that it does not suffer from the suddenness of the weather, being immersed in the benefit of that which helps the cautery not to be scorched, especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, which are strong and fiery, which do not suffer from delay so that it is feared that those which come late will bring malice, which is greater than a slight neglect of the time.</end_of_turn>
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	I do not consent in empty words, or, children, those who do not esteem except the vulgar people and fools, doctors, for that disease which is cured by cautery is not ridiculous at all times, and pause that consequence.</end_of_turn>
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not that they say it is because they take care of it with water, for cautery is nothing but in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries the humors which are the cause of these pains.</end_of_turn
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Moreover, however, cautery surpasses medicine by its desire for its value and the virtue of its operation and the greatness of the Lord's gift.</end_of_turn>
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that your disease will return at any time of the day, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of the disease, and the virtue of the treatment, and what is prepared in the body of the patient from the accumulation of superfluities in it, and what is obtained by him in the acquisition of food and drink, and from those causes; but the disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease of a few superfluities and humors, just as if it were cautery of teeth for pain and as it is in this way that it is possible that in it the said pain will not return, even though it is done in small quantities.</end_of_turn
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And perhaps the vulgar saying is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and a saying of the learned, not to those who understand it, for they believe that it is not a cure that makes use of medicine or of any other cause except cautery.</end_of_turn
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is the opposite of that; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is true only when they administer the methods of treatment in certain diseases, and those medicines do not benefit, and in the end of the cause they administer manes cautery, and make use of that.</end_of_turn
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And so it is that from here it can be understood that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding which the vulgar people and fools of the doctors have of it.</end_of_turn
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and I do not say this except for the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.</end_of_turn
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And I say that the place of cautery does not make it fierce, as it is not absolutely true, for I myself have seen that it does no harm in any other parts, and that cautery with that is good and better than with iron, even though they say so; however, when you do cautery with fire from gold, it is not for you to declare, for it is ignited according to the quantity you wish for the roughness of the gold, and prepare to receive cold; and if you add too much fire to it the gold will melt for the fire, and if you are unlucky in the fire some plates will be broken because the artificer will take hold of it for the work.</end_of_turn
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason it is useful to do cautery with iron, you must put it lightly and more cautiously to the right of the operation.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those that are among the feet to be omitted, so that I can relieve the seeker of what he demands of me.</end_of_turn
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for head pain from cold and humidity.</end_of_turn
Le capitol primier.	Chapter one.</end_of_turn>
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers upon cold and humid air the accidental cause of which it is a cause of soda and multiple flows of humors rheumatic, applied to the head and the flanks of the humors and the surrounding areas fluent, and multiple sleep, and toothache and headache, and universally of every disease that comes from cold, even as paralysis, tetanus and apoplexy, and is similar in those diseases.</end_of_turn
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this, that first of all it commands the patient to be evacuated with medical laxatives, the head being moistened with medicine for three or four nights, according to the excess of the virtue of the disease and the age of the patient and his custom.</end_of_turn
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And I command him to shave the head of the patient, and that he make this pass between his legs over a fallen bench and that he place his hand on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And keep your thumb close to the base of your nose between your eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Moreover, since the physician has already said of the location of the affected area, sign that place with your finger, and then cauterize with an olive-shaped instrument of this kind:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And keep your hand still over the area to be treated, in such a way that your thumb will gradually descend, to which your hand should be clasped tightly, and you should rotate it
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then gently lift your hand and support the area, and if you see any part of the bone already uncovered, as much as a grain of wheat, then elevate your hand again, and if you do not turn your hand away from the instrument, do so from the other side, until the bone is visible as much as I have said
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And take a little salt and dissolve it on the area and leave it on for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And keep your knee bandaged on the border and leave it on until the burn mark of the fire is gone
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the area with tetracycline until it is healed
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And indeed when the wound remains open, it is better to take off the bandage, because it is better and more healing
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	I say to you all that the bone must be cauterized until the bone itself, and that you must hold the cautery until all the parts of the bone are healed.</start_of_turn>
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And keep the wound clean of the bone, and finally cure it.</start_of_turn>
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And I say that the cautery must be applied towards the heel, until the bone feels strong pain in the bone itself, which is the way to make a small incision:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they say that from that area vapor rises from the head.

De cauterizacio de turtura.	Capital six.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The sixth degree of cautery.

When tears of the humors are old and settle upon the veins and arteries that are in the head, it is confirmed that these are superfluous free fatty humors. Therefore, cauterize the point which we mentioned at the beginning of this discourse concerning the cold humors which cause thirst, and the point in the middle of the head, and two cauteries in the armpits, two on the temples, and two on the armpits of two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is indigestion from excess, then cauterize that point throughout the waist of the belly above the little toe with a small cautery.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cautery for the pain of the nose.</end_of_turn>
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your physician has said enough and has not benefited from his medication, then you shall appear and give the patient wine to drink for three nights; and at the same time take his head in your hand and cauterize the point between the eyebrows and the olive.</end_of_turn
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And also cauterize the point between the eyebrows with two cauteries above the two nostrils so that the hair is cut off a little.</end_of_turn
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And take care that you do not burn the skin.</end_of_turn
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the manner of the cautery between the eyebrows.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.</end_of_turn
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cautery for the swelling of the eyelids of the humors.</end_of_turn
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the humor is swollen due to disease or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a lunar cautery; this is how to do it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish, cauterize above the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries throughout, and let them be longer than the temples.</end_of_turn
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	Let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of the eyebrow.</end_of_turn
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not burn your hand too much with the cautery, but as much as the third part of the eyelid is adhered.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.</end_of_turn
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cautery of the eyelid of the humor when its tears have become converted to drops and put its hand on the humor.</end>
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the tears of the humor have become converted to drops and put its hand on the humor, cauterize in those two ways, either by burning or by medicinal powder.</end_of_turn
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you burn with the cautery, order the patient to drink until the tears flow freely again as before; and if you put on the cautery, strengthen the humors of the patient with a bandage so that they do not suffer until the tears are reborn.</end_of_turn
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	When they are reborn and equal, then take the patient's head in your hand and place your hand over the eyelids of the patient with your finger, as with the figure of a laurel leaf, and let the signal begin from the tears.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And also stop the bleeding with albumin of blood or in egg white over the humor.</end_of_turn
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And do this with the cautery that we have mentioned.</end_of_turn
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And cauterize over the sign that you have made, little by little, in moist tears, until the surface of the wound is like a laurel leaf, completely apparent in the same way.</end_of_turn
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of the completion of your work is that you see the eyelid of the humor already contracting and the tears of the humor already raised above the puncture of the humor.</end_of_turn
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so lift your hand and keep it there for three days, and stop the bleeding over it with a border until the wound is healed.</end_of_turn>
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And take care of it until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	However, if it returns for any reason, order them to drink again and the eyelid is swollen, then do the cautery once more over the whole thing as you did at first.</end_of_turn
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	However, if the tears are on the eyelid, then cauterize only when it is raised to its natural place and is equal, and that the tears do not touch the humor.</end_of_turn
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	The patient should be commanded to rest in bed until the pain has subsided and equilibrium is restored. And let a paste of slippery paper be applied in the form of a leaf of mirtle.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And let him take nourishment of broth and live on broth alone for now.</end_of_turn> namely.</end_of_turn> Or what you will, mix these things together and make a fasting for him so that he is not chilled; and spread a little of that over the paper which is applied thus like a leaf of mirtle, and rest your hand over the heel or both; and let the patient's head rest in the armpit of the album of the hand, and keep his chest still.</end_of_turn>
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And let me tell you about the medicine and give him a little, but do not delay until he has felt the benefit of the medicine, because the benefit is in him just like fire.</end_of_turn
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Therefore when you perceive that the other pain has ceased, then read the medicine and do not touch him until he has told you that; when the pain has ceased, then remain with the medicine and wash his hand with water; and when you have finished, consider whether the eye has already recovered just as if it had been washed away by the constriction of fire or incision, for the hour is like that; and if it does not return concerning the medicine on that part where you did not impress the medicine and did not denigrate it until the operation is completed and the hand is restored.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And let rest over his heel near the border until the spur of the wound has disappeared, and take care of him until he is deafened or until he is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary that you, after your operation, diligently guard the hand so that the medicine does not fall from it, and if the eye has become softened for a few days due to the pricking of the needles in the hand, then repeat your medicine on that part where the eye is softened, just as you did at the beginning, and keep it there until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the form of the mirtle leaf.</end_of_turn>
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Note that the humors of men are diverse according to their magnitude and quantity, and therefore according to what is useful for you.</end_of_turn
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not be ignorant of the right way to treat this.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cautery of fistula in the tear duct of the hand.</end_of_turn
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat the fistula with what we have said in the divisions of diseases and you do not fear the consequence of your treatment, then order the patient to rest his head on his chest, and keep his head in the hands of any minister between the thighs in such a way that it is not maimed or agitated on the head of the patient.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And let rest the heel immersed in the water of the album or in mucus of peas on the hand of him.</end_of_turn
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And let him cauterize with the instrument whose form is this:</start>
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is concave, like a tube or a wheel of fire, from one extremity to the other where the cautery is to be made.</start
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, penetrate through to the other extremity.</start
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, go out like this as well.</start
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	Better is the one that is concave to the chest.</start
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And if the fistula is open, grasp it and bring it to health and dry it off.</start
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.</start
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And let rest over the heel let the cautery be well ignited, and take care that your hand does not move or that the patient becomes restless, and let rest the cautery on the gray matter of the hand and break that.</start
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	Therefore if at the beginning of the cautery it enters the bone, do not do it; but if it does enter, repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then rest over that heel near the border and send it away with great exsiccation until it is healed.</start
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after passing twenty days it is not healed, then rest over the acute corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is scraped as it is fitting in the aforementioned chapter.</start
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And thus is another method of cautery, which the first physicians said: enter the site of the fistula and when you have done so, pause for a moment in that cavity where the shape of it is like a bed of nails; and there let the quantity of blood which has fled be; and keep your hand pressed against the wound with good retention, and do not be afraid of the patient because the blood will not reach the head of the wound; and cover that head of the wound with alum of lead or in water, so that the blood adheres to the site of the fistula and heals that for a miraculous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by the blood which we have said of the cautery and the cure, that is well; but if not, it is necessary to administer a purgative from the nose and reduce the fistula to the head of the nose as it will be in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of the cautery of the wound.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	The veins become swollen and inflamed in the lips, and more especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore when you cure those wounds by the water which we have said in the divisions and do not avail yourself of your cure, then indeed you must make a small burn according to this fashion:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And the curvature of it according to the form of a box.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	And pause for a moment that quantity of liquid which has escaped within those wounds until the burn reaches the head of the wounds.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And thus care for that until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of the cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When on the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth there is swelling and the lip becomes broken, and is softened, and the vein bursts, and a fistula is made, and when you do not avail yourself of the cure, then indeed you must burn according to the quantity which is received in the fistula, and put that flame in the rectum of the fistula, and keep your hand over that until the flame reaches the head of it, and after that make some bleeding or two; and then care for that until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And thus if the swelling is abscessed and is healed, that is well; but if not, it is necessary to uncover the place and support the decaying bone according to what will be said in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of the cautery of the teeth and the softening of the veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the veins are softened by humidity and the teeth are stained, and you treat them with medicines and do not confide in them, then indeed you must place the head of the patient in the belly and burn the form of which will come to pass in this way, that you must pause the quantity which is over the tooth until the burn has reached the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And thus take your hand away, and burn several times according to your wish
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And thus moisten the patient’s mouth with salt water and keep it there for an hour, and then remove it, for the stained tooth is stopped and the softened gum is strengthened and the moisture which was corrupted is dried up
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the treatment of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is from cold, or it is hot or does not avail itself of the cure with medicine, then indeed you must burn in two ways: either with a burn from the cows or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The burn from the cows is that you take the border of cows and burn it in a crucible of iron, and you take some butter and cover it over the extremity of the limb, and you put that which is buttered over the painful tooth until it is inflamed.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And thus burn several times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	Or if you wish, immerse wool or butter in the border mentioned above, and place that on the painful tooth, and place over that the burning iron until the iron reaches the depth of the cavity of the tooth
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	More importantly, when you burn with fire you must attend to the quantity of charcoal or iron, and be in the center of the cavity of the tooth so that the acute heat does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And thus draw the cautery in the shape it will come, and keep it above the nail and put your hand over it until it is inflamed; and do whatever you can to make the pain subside, whether today or tomorrow or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And so, for the purpose of this cautery, that the patient should fill their mouth with good broth for an hour, and then wipe it away; this is the shape of the cautery.</end_of_turn>
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And burn as much as you can of the extremities according to your ability.</end_of_turn>
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the shape of the cannula:</end_turn
Capitol .xxii.	Capitol .xxii.</end_turn>
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cautery of external swellings.</end_turn
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When external swellings are due to cold humors and do not obey digestion by medicines, then you must ignite the cautery to its shape as described below, having two extremities covered so as to escape the smoke of the cautery from the other, and keep the flame above the swelling for a while, and do the same again if necessary, until the swelling has disappeared.</end_turn
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling is slight, then keep the cautery away from the quantity of the swelling, and let it rest for three days, and place it over the edge of the swelling until the fire that has consumed it has gone out.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And take care that the patient does not suffer from pain, and try and wrap and cover with cloths until they are healed.</end_of_turn>
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or the cautery should be such as to convert.</end_turn
Capitol .xxiii.	Capitol .xxiii.</end_turn
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of the cautery of the throat and constriction of the belly.</end_turn
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity is over the root of the lung, and especially when it is the cold of complexion, then you must make the patient evacuate at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize the area where the tonsils are rooted in the indented place.</end_turn
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	Beware that you do not reach the tonsils or burn the edge of the tongue, but only a little.</end_turn
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize the other side of the cautery must be at the joint of the colon in the back of the vertebra of the belly.</end_turn
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery of the belly should be similar to the previous one.</end_turn
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And take care that what precedes is finished before it is healed.</end_turn
Capitol .xxiiii.	Capitol .xxiiii.</end_of_turn
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of the cautery of the lung disease and cough.</end>
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are due to cold humidity and the patient has neither fever nor chills and is an old disease, then you must make two cauteries on the furcula in the indented places on the front and back; and another cautery in the middle of the foot between two nipples; and the cautery should be similar to the previous one.</end_turn
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	Or if you wish, make the puncture with the cautery that is called puncture, whose shape you will find in the puncture of heel pain.</end_turn

De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of the cautery of the stomach
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there is cold and moist humors in the stomach that come out of its composition and multiply in it, and if you continue the treatments and do not confirm them, then know that the patient must be placed on their side, extend their hands and feet, and then cauterize three times: on one cautery leave the toes for the quantity of one finger at the level of the Achilles, and on two cauteries leave the two sides of the cautery, until the triangular shape of the cautery appears; and lengthen between those that are not adjusted that will make the burn less painful.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of cautery of dislocation of the ankle.</start_of_turn

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Concerning the cautery of the sciatic vein.</end_of_turn>
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When there is pain in the ankle area, due to cold and moisture, the ailment is cured with the things that we have already mentioned and not otherwise; and when it has been treated, when you have left the cold and moisture of the humors, then you can cauterize the area with strong pills or artificial or similar pills; and do the cautery.</end_of_turn
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	There are two methods for doing the cautery: with medicinal powders that burn, or with fire.</end_of_turn
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	There are two scientific methods, of which one is to cauterize the area around the ankle with three triangular cauteries in this shape; and do it to a good depth.</end_of_turn
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space between each cautery is equal to the thickness of the finger, and if it is an olive or large cautery.</end_of_turn
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Some people say that the cautery should be done on the middle of the ankle for it is four cauteries.</end_of_turn
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena. E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	This is the method of cautery for the sciatica when the pain is limited to the ankle and does not extend into the thigh.</end_of_turn
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	If it extends into the thigh, then do two cauteries on the thigh over the area where you feel the pain; and one cautery on the heel for four fingers just below the hip bone.</end_of_turn
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	If the cautery is blistering, and the depth of the cautery is according to the amount of spiciness of the area.</end_of_turn
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	If the pain extends to the feet, then do the cautery here where you feel the pain with three points or four or more if you deem it necessary.</end_of_turn
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	If the pain is left after the swelling has gone down, then do the cautery here with a blistering cautery.</end_of_turn
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	Beware in all cauteries that you do not burn nerves or large arteries, and that for this reason you must be careful not to cause damage to the pain or contraction.</end_of_turn

I have already seen two cases where someone has cauterized the heel and finished the cautery, and the limb became inflamed until the tumor disappeared, and the limb was perforated and corrupted throughout.</end_of_turn

Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray. Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XXXIIII
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	Of the cautery at the beginning of gonorrhea
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Many times this disease is seen in young children; and the sign of the beginning of the disease in children is that it affects the structure around the anus, causing elevation and difficulty in movement

Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of the cautery of gout and joint pain
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	Therefore when gout is caused by heat it is cured by means of treatment and not by remaining silent, for the pain persists until it is cauterized

E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar. And if these needles are not enough for you, then cauterize that and do not hold your hand too close to the cautery, but rather only as much as is necessary to keep the area still
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pains go up to the heel of the foot, then administer the cautery that we have said in the previous chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pains are only in the great toe, and it is called sugra, then point in the circuit of the bones as if you were rotating, point in those two lines
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pain remains in these places, then point on the circumference of the bones over every bone and over the side of the hand
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	If pain persists close to the joints for several days, or to the bones or muscles, then cauterize all those which are affected throughout the body.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	Do not evacuate the patient promptly without a good regimen and medication, for if there is a good regimen and inflammation, it is evacuated with this cautery without any other medicine, God helps.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xlv.	Capital letter xlv.</end_of_turn>
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On cautery of ruptures.</end_of_turn>
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When the rupture is in the ankle and saying the bones are dented under the heel bone, and when it begins to approach, then command the patient to lie down and use soft cushions so that the wound does not open from the belly.</end_of_turn

De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of the cautery of leprosy.</end_of_turn>
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Many books speak of a great benefit in burning for leprosy, and management if the species of leprosy that causes putrefaction of fat and melancholy is present.</end_of_turn
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore when you wish to burn [leprosy], consider if the leprosy is acute or chronic; and that which has been cured by water as we have said in the division and not by burning, neither this nor that; and fear lest the corruption should encompass the whole body and its entirety, for the burn should be applied to the head with two cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and one at the back of the head, over the eyebrows; and two on the temples; and one at the back, over the nape of the neck or on the servant's hand.</end_of_turn
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally hold your hand over the burn for a little while until a small ulcer forms on the bone, and when the scales are loosened from it, so that the emission of thick vapor is relieved from it; and burn on the heel as required.</end_of_turn
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the body and appears manifest, the hour is that you burn in these very burns that we have said in the head; and burn on the tip of the nose, and two burns on the two cheekbones, and two burns on two vertebrae of the collarbone, and five burns on the vertebrae of the thorax, and one large one on the vertebrae close to the shoulder, and one on the shoulder, and two on the arms, and two on the hands, and two on the knees, and two on the muscles, and two on the little toes; and burn on all the joints of the fingers and toes, and on all the bones of the limbs and on the bones of the face.</end_of_turn
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And take care of the nerves that are over the heel that you do not burn them.</end_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And many are cauterized with a burn on the bone of the thumb and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the heel.</end_of_turn
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that when you adjust many cauteries, the more the benefit and the more effective; and know that the body has already become stupefaied from the pain.</end_of_turn

E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And immediately pause in the flame the cauteries of olive oil a few and many, by number more, and blow over those until they are no longer ignited
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And immediately take from those a little or a great according to the place and the disease in which the artery is broken, over that vein tightly holding back the bleeding that remains until the wound is closed and that the saint is withdrawn.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the saint is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you have closed the wound and squeezed out the cautery, then take another cautery and cover it loosely over the cauteries that are in the fire, and do not cease doing so until the saint is withdrawn
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	Be careful that you do not burn the nerves that are here, and that you come back to the patient with another disease.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you know that when an artery bursts a saint, it is not possible in those circumstances to restrict the saint, and especially when the artery is great, if not with one of the following four means: or with that which has been said, or with extraction when it is not extracted, for when it is extracted the limbs are burnt and the saint is withdrawn, or that it be bound with thread or a ligament for strong support, or that they be held with medicines whose virtue is to restrict the saint; and that they be strengthened by applying pressure with a cushion or cushion-like device.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	May he who administers restrictions decent of him and limits stricture with draps or by position of causes comburentz and of semblance, do not confer except with wrath.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If he is not a doctor and has no medicine, when he understands that the opening has been made over that vein as we have said, he must understand that the patient is in great distress, for the sovereign remedy of the plague has passed, and that the wound must not be remade; and that it should be washed with cold water until the wound is healed and hardened; and that he must take care that there is no need for cautery or other medicine.</end_of_turn>
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second section.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and winds and of phlegm and of plagues and of their appearances.</end_of_turn>
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words of Albucazes.</end_of_turn>
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter that in all diseases in which cautery is convenient and medicine is comburent, and the occasions and causes of them, and the instruments necessary for them in the forms of cautery; and I have ordered the chapters of the sovereignty of the head to the feet.</end_of_turn
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter with that measure, so that what is desired may be alleviated, when it has been demanded.</end_of_turn
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And I say that in this chapter there is terror concerning what is in the first chapter of cautery.</end_of_turn
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for this reason great caution must be taken, because in the operation in this chapter many things are to be avoided, such as the evacuation of the intestines which is with the saint with which life is bound up, the bursting of the vein or incision over the abscess or opening of pus, the extraction of a splinter or the incision of a stone or any other similar thing.</end_of_turn
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all these things are accompanied by fear and tremor and in most of them death.</end_of_turn
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I admonish you that you should not be terrified of this, because many veined persons have managed to perform these things without any other casualties than those of the disease.</end_of_turn
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And it is from these that some recover from their disease, and it is lighter for them than death, and this is for the gentleness of their disease, and for the length of their disease, and for the fear of the disease which means death.</end_of_turn
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from these things is that which gives you hope and speech, your expectation of that saint, and the swiftness of your disease is pernicious.</end_of_turn>
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	Therefore do not consent to any one who uses this method; and your caution should be greater than your desire and your speed; and do not presume any cause except for a certain knowledge which will inform you what you must do, and to which you may expect success.</end_of_turn
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the care of all sick people the prognosis and indication which are the salvation of health and the obtaining of fame and memory, of the savior and of glory.</end_of_turn
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, children, God inspires you with his understanding and does not command you except with direction and protection, for what is in his hand.</end_of_turn>

And I have ordered this chapter to be distinguished by chapters according to the order of the chapter of cautery, from the head to the feet, so that what you desire of what you need be alleviated.</end_of_turn
