De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the care of water which is contained in the head of children.</end_of_turn
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Be wise that this disease does not usually happen to children until the nurse opens the head of the child, when its life is in danger.</end_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And there are many veined persons for whom the cause is unknown.</end_of_turn
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have not seen this disease except in children; and with all those whom I have seen it has been accompanied by death, and for this reason I consider it my work to leave it behind in those.</end_of_turn
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water, the head of which was always swollen until it could not be closed except with difficulty by the great size of the head, and that even when it was closed the moisture increased until death.</end_of_turn

Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	When the operation is performed in such a place where the humidity is between the navel and the knee and the apostemes are few, it is necessary that you make an incision in the middle of the thigh with a fissure extending two notches beyond the level of the humidity. This is the form of the scar.
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the humidity is more increased and the apostemes are great, it is necessary to make two incisions according to this method:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is left on the bone, a sign of this is that you sometimes open the roof of the head or the water is squeezed out when you press that area with your thumb against the sides and it is not that which is seen on the face.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Therefore make three incisions in the middle of the thigh according to this method
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And immediately extract all the humidity; then strengthen the incisions with strips and gauze; then pour oil and wine over the wound from above and olive oil from below for five days; then remove the ligatures and care for the wound with attempts and poultices, and strengthen the thigh equally; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity until the limb is comfortable and healed.</end_of_turn>
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	There is another method of incision which considers the size of the apostemes and the collection of the water, for some veins are more prominent in the occiput or in the front, or on the right or on the left; and therefore attend to the incision where the apostemes appear and the collection of the water, and make the incision as small as possible.</end_of_turn>

Observe that you must not incision the artery, and be careful that no blood flows out, and keep the patient still for that flow of blood with the evacuation of the humidity.

Therefore take care when you wish to make the incision that the patient does not move his head, and strengthen the ankle joint with rough hands; and consider where the vein is placed; and the places where some are near the ankles depressed, so that you do not damage them.

And take care of the surrounding vessels with attempts, and make incisions of some part that is acutely painful at the incision to reach the bone, and be as little invasive as possible.</start_of_turn

E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be two fingers wide, for when any vein is incised the blood is ejected with a pulsatile flow, which leaps from side to side frequently.</start_of_turn

More if the artery does not appear at the incision, take care that you measure the ankle three fingers wide, and take care with attempts, and make it reach the bone.</start_of_turn

And as for the amount of blood that comes from the wound is the quantity of one cup.</start_of_turn And it is little or much that comes from it according to the quantity that appears from the virtue of the patient and the repletion of the artery of them.</start_of_turn

De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.</start_of_turn
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When there are some old accidents that remain ancient or acute, for humors of the earth and for the quality in the lacerations of the temples, or so ancient and similar to these, and when these cannot be cured by the methods of medical care and what is not comfortable, then we must resort to the extraction of the arteries in the temples, or the cauterization of these veins as we have shown.</start_of_turn

And the method of the operation and extraction of these is that the patient raises the parts that are in the temples; and understand that the visible artery in the temple is that which is shown to you by the thumb, and that which is hidden is only in a few people by force of heat.</start_of_turn
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	If it is hidden from you, the hour of the patient's suffering is when their limbs become strong with some warmth; and immediately cool the area with an rough sponge or evaporate it with cold water until the swelling subsides.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And thus you take the sponge which is its shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And immediately put the sponge on the area which facilitates until you reach the swelling; and immediately take hold of the area upwards and outwards so that you extract that from the bony parts until you extract that from the tendon and uncover that from the clothes which you have left behind, from all parts.</start_of_turn>

May be if the artery is small, the hour involves covering that with the limb, and immediately cut off a piece of that according to the quantity by which the limb is elongated and contracted, and do not allow blood to flow, for if it is not cut off, the blood will not be restored at all.</start_of_turn>

And if the swelling is great, the hour is to cover that in two places with strong double cloth or cords of length, and do not cover it up until the decay has ceased and the swelling has subsided.</start_of_turn

It is better work if the patient has a fever or is suffering from inflamed swelling; for the cautery is of those causes which help the humors to vanish, and therefore it is better in treatment.</start_of_turn

And cover immediately the extraction of the arteries which you see at the ankle, and keep them covered with fine powder sufficiently to prevent them from bleeding, and immediately apply either a cure with dry medications or make an ointment of herbs to make the wound heal and soften the swelling until it is healed.</start_of_turn

And if while you are working another wound begins to bleed from the artery, the hour is to restrict that bleeding, either by cautery or by tying off the artery, or by packing the wound, and hold your hand firmly until the bleeding has ceased.</start_of_turn

And what is more curious in the extraction of the artery is that you cauterize the vein in this way having two nails, since you have marked the two places with a touch, and you remove whatever is between them, not burning, until you reach the bone and split the vein in two places, so that it is elongated between the limbs which are not consolidated at all by this cautery.</start_of_turn

E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the pain of the two nails is intense.</start_of_turn

De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the care of the limbs of the acute and acidic humors of the bones.</start_of_turn
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa. E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then bring together the edge of two sharp extremities, from which this is the shape of the incision of them:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the lower part of the temples to the second incision
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Extract from that all the marrow which is between two incisions on the bone, and place that which is over the bone on the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And place again this pad and put into the first incision another instrument which is called curette, blunt from one side and pointed on the other side
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	Close the wound of the bone which is attached to the marrow from the bone which is in front of it, and the skin which does not reach the bone, and fill that up until it reaches the fracture which has just been made, and close with all the vessels that descend from the head to the feet
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	Maybe the incision should be continued until the marrow, and place that which is in the middle of the fracture inside the other fracture
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when the wound has healed, press the area of the bones of the wound with cotton wool
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And keep in any fracture a coat of old cloth, and place over those powders soaked in wine and oil and vinegar, and anything which does not cause a burn.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day remove the ligament and administer great effusion of warm water or tepid, and take care that there be oil of basilisk with rosemary and other things which will make the wounds heal.

De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Concerning the care of the limbs from the parts which descend from the temples of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the limb bones are acute and continue, and sometimes the bones of the patient’s foot extend slightly, and in these cases the custom is to take precautions, for the palpebras are ulcerated and their socket is painful, and in the front of the head there is sudden pain of toothache and subsequent vomiting, due to the fact that the matters and bones do not circulate but by veins from the parts which proceed downwards
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	The best care for these is that the patient should eat softly, and immediately make an incision in the middle of the forehead, a little for the width (and begin from the left temporal bone to the right temporal bone; and let the incision be from the bone; and stretch your hand from the temples which are grasped by the teeth). Until the bone is exposed
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Extract all the marrow from the wound with sponge or dry cloth and immediately replace between the two lips of the fracture with old cloth or linen cloth
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And immediately put on them powders soaked in wine and oil to prevent a burn
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	When you have removed that and you see that the swelling has already diminished, the time has come to cool the bones until they begin to regain their flesh, and take care of that which regulates the exsiccation which makes the flesh grow, as if you were taking two parts of wheat and four parts of barley and mixing them together, or, make plaster of them and administer it to these wounds when the flesh has been reborn
Capitol .vi.	End of book. VI
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Concerning the care of what is in the ankles
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the causes which are in the ankles are of four kinds, which are either mineral stones or which resemble stones, such as iron and lead, or which are of plant origin such as fennel or peas, or which are of a fluid origin such as vinegar and wine and which resemble them, or any beast
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	Therefore when a stone is in the ankle or any other cause which does not adjust or grow in the ankle, and if sometimes the stone comes out in such a cause as oil or vinegar or saw dust, and immediately administer the extraction of it, and make it vomit with condiment, and apply pressure to the wound to prevent further vomiting.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And so keep your hand over the ankle and remove some of the wool or cloth from around it, since thickened matters cause pain in these parts.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If it is not painful, then administer extraction from it with the instrument called epicaricary spoon, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If it is thickened with the spoon, it is enough; otherwise, administer the extraction from it with little duplication.</start_of_turn>
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	Therefore, if it is not thickened by that, then make a needle of gut and insert the end of the needle into the hole of the ankle and close around the needle with wax and olive oil so that only the needle remains visible.</start_of_turn>
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And so draw out from the belly with strong traction, since thickened matters are like those that we have recounted.</start_of_turn
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	If it is not thickened in this manner, then take a lighted splinter or a piece of burnt wood and grasp the nails with a quantity of powder, and place that on the edge of the wound, and wrap around it adequately.</start_of_turn
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And so insert it into the hole of the ankle easily, and then extract the ankle from the moisture.</start_of_turn
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	Therefore, if it is not thickened by all the causes that we have recounted, then you must consider cutting off that which is causing the swelling or spasm.</start_of_turn
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting off that which is causing the swelling is to cauterize the inflamed vein and extract it according to the virtue of the instruments, and then make a small incision in the heel and convert the ankle to the parts above, and make a small fissure in the heel and let out the black matter from it.</start_of_turn
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the incision be like a crescent moon until it reaches the bone, and when the bone is grasped, hold that back with the instruments at hand; and immediately close the incision at that moment, and care for it until it is healed.</start_of_turn
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the swelling in the ankle is one of the humors that grows and inflates, then administer the curage and the extraction of it; but if you do not obey our advice immediately, then take sponge-baths of this sort:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with that the evacuation of that humor which is causing the swelling in the ankle.</start_of_turn
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not hesitate when you think that that has already been moistened by the vapor of the ankle, and keep it in thick masses, and draw out the rest with nails or with a spoon, or by incision as we have said, for the extraction is alleviated.</start_of_turn
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water in which it is introduced into the ankle, so that the pain uses up its spasm at the beginning, and fill the ankle with about one cubit of old clothes, and hold over that ankle in which the water is, and if by that it is thickened, it is not good; otherwise, take three or four nails of the length of the finger, and burn them in the fire a little, and when they are cold put one of those into the hole of the ankle and jump over one leg of that side and strike the other leg against the leg which is causing the ankle.</start_of_turn
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not stop until all the water is thickened.</start_of_turn>
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water is thickened like this, then you take paper or gut.</start_of_turn And put one extremity into the ankle and extend the other extremity over the fire until it is burnt out the most of it.</start_of_turn
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And so put in another gut and draw out the water until all the water is thickened, and then extract that with a needle as is said to be the extracting bone.</start_of_turn
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of beasts entering that ankle, if it is small in size, hold it firmly and keep it still, care for it as we have said in the division; but if it is of great size which causes pain at the same time, then administer the extraction from it with instruments and nails, and the cause of the pain is less severe than all the other causes that cause swelling in the ankle.</start_of_turn
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worms engendered in the ankle, when you have cared for that as we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and you do not suffer your cure, then consider that you must request the ankle to the sun.</start_of_turn
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Therefore, if there appears here any cause of the worms, then extract that with instruments or with fine needles, but if no cause appears, then take a needle with a broad handle of which this is the form.</start_of_turn
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	The patient's foot is affected by a severe inflammatory swelling caused by cold humors. The physician must make an incision along the ankle bone according to the degree of swelling; then he must drain the abscess with a pointed instrument, taking care not to damage the surrounding tissue.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	If you do not obey my advice, know that I have closed the circuit of the vein with wax as we have said; now administer the distillations that have already been prepared in the care of the worms, and you will find them in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be like the one that expels the medicinal oils from the ankle with this instrument of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make it of silver or gold, leaving a slight space, in which there is a small hole, and place a piece of gauze over it.</start_of_turn>
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And thus do as it is said in order that it be in the cavity of the ankle here where it is necessary.</start_of_turn>
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the ray and wrap it around the limb adequately, and then pour oil into the cavity of the ankle, or juice of any herb, or whatever you wish of these medicines in the vein — and that is in the ankle — and then insert the ray into the coto and press with your hand that which is at compression at the same time as the oil is expelled from the cavity of the ankle and the patient feels the oil remaining inside.</start_of_turn>
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which is infused into the ankle is already scorched with fire a little.</start_of_turn
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And keep in mind that the cause for which you distill in the ankle should not be too strong, because the ankle medicines do not suffer from that.</start_of_turn

De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the care of the swelling of the ankles.</start_of_turn
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some veins of young children and some veins of elder people are not perforated; and when they already happen in veins of adult men, swelling in the ankle for pain or for nothing in particular; and this swelling is useful in the preparation of the wound of the ankle which does not always succeed, and some are in the distant parts.</start_of_turn
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the preparation of them, which does not always succeed, is in the greatest possibilities of difficult healing.</start_of_turn
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that in which you succeed, keep the ankle of the patient to the sun and rest in that.</start_of_turn
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And thus if sometimes the swelling appears, open that with a pointed instrument of which this is the form.</start_of_turn
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the limb in which it is small has a sharp and a blunt part; and the abscess is of two lips like a lion so that it does not damage the ankle.</start_of_turn
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And thus if the swelling is for a wound that has been born in the ankle or in the meat of the limb, then do that with fine nails and pierce that with ease until all the flesh is gone.</start_of_turn
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the swelling is in the preparation of the ankle, then take a ray like a lion and burn that a little, and then put that on the meat of the ankle.</start_of_turn
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And thus if you smell swelling with that which the patient finds with ease, because of gravity, try to compress that with ease; and keep in mind that you must not damage the nerves of the ankle.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And thus keep the ankle wrapped around like the amount of the breadth of the wound which you have enveloped with Egyptian unguent; and do that for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or that you take some other thing and put that in oil and grind over it and use that; and if sometimes the ankle has already healed, then do that cover that which you took out and change that for another which you have wrapped in cerate that is useful with olive oil, until that which is apostematized has given way; and keep that until it is healed.</start_of_turn
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If there happens to be flux of pus, then immerse sponges or cloth in cold water and place over the ankle, and use another treatment which restricts the flow of pus, which is mentioned in the treatise on distillations.</start_of_turn
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.</start_of_turn
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the care of the styes which are attached to the eyelids.</start_of_turn
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	The styes which are attached to the eyelashes are some wet and some dry.</start_of_turn
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore cover those with whom you hold or support, and uncover those with whom you wish to leave, and immediately pause over the affected area.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	Maybe if pain comes from the flow of blood, then you cauterize those who are loose like barley grains.</end_of_turn>
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery is that the black blisters and the like disappear when any cause of their origin has disappeared; and when they are cauterized with fire, those origins are consumed and do not return.</end_of_turn>

Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Great pain that comes to the pupils of the eyes.</end_of_turn>
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Black blisters arise on the pupils of the eyes for any cause that resembles greatness in its strength and hardness, and because of this greatness it is called.</end_of_turn
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of great humidity in the eyelid outwards and downwards.</end_of_turn
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore the operation for them is that you consider if the greatness is proceeding from them from outside the eye and is widespread; and the cause of it is slight.</end_of_turn
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore remove from that on which the fissure is made for the breadth, and quickly drain that from all around so that it escapes easily, and then suspend that which is on the outside and cut away that.</end_of_turn
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you do not uncover the beginning of the disease if you do not pierce the eye with a slight incision little by little, the hour it will not be noticed in any cause.</end_of_turn
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is great, the hour you adjust it with a suture; and care for that until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is slight, do not overdo it for that because the language of it restores that and nourishes.</end_of_turn
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the greatness is waning at the margins of the eye you must touch the surface of the eye, the hour you remove the eye and suspend the greatness all over, except that you do not touch the origin, and cut away that from all around, and if the eye is injured by the incision, the hour it will not be noticed in any cause.</end_of_turn
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And finally, at the incision, wash the eye with salt water; and care for the area of the eye where it has healed until it is healed.</end_of_turn

De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Concerning the care of the outside of the eye from the pupil downwards.</end>
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Grayish is what is generated in the tunics of the eye downwards, and especially in children, aggravates the eyes of those who suffer from it and causes them to blur; and it does not permit the clarity of the sun because the tears are hidden by them.</end>
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And for this reason sometimes those who walk around always keep their eyes open, and over those who sleep; and over the eyes of those who leave them their eyebrows wet, which have already covered the inflammation, and imminent appearance of inflammation is in the eye; and that when you press on the area around it says that there is inflammation within those.</end
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And any way of operating is in that one in which the patient’s eye rests on the palm of the hand, and you quickly touch it and make it callous, and make a circle according to the quantity that contains all the matter of the circle, and quickly touch that over that and cut from all around so that it is aggregated in the middle of the circle, and finally remove that humidity that is incident on the fissure made for the breadth, and the fissure should not be greater than the fissure that is made in flaccidity.</end
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	Therefore before you make the incision cover the whole circumference until you reach the matter, because in the meantime the process of the matter will proceed by fissure according to the shape of white grease.</end>
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore extract that which you wrap around which you have enveloped between the thumbs and the little fingers and rotate between the right and left hand until it is dispersed.</end
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And take care that you do not make the incision too wide so that the matter does not reach the pupil and remove that.</end
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see the matter at the beginning of the incision, just make the incision slightly wider so that the matter is processed; and quickly extract that which we have said; and then cover it with a drape of cloth and wine vinegar and pause it over the area and open those which are dusty.</end
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so when you have finished salt and paused that in the concavity of the incision so that what remains of that humidity.</end

Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	Even if the limb is scorched by the cautery, care for the one who has healed well.</end_turn>

When the humors in the eyes become natural and old, the hour of the disease approaches, and tears become frequent, mucus of the eyes and skin arise from this, that is, that the humors that cause destruction of the eye that is called to be evacuated from the eye. De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	On the care of the wound on the nail bed
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz. De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of the incision of the nail and the eminence of the flesh of the lacrimals.</end_of_turn
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Wise men know that the nail is according to two ways, that is either nervous or non-nervous. The nervous is like a hard, soft sponge; or it is non-nervous, like white humidity that is frozen, which when you touch it, or force it to take hold with the nail, it is torn and the nail is not held by it.</end_of_turn
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel. The manner of working in the incision of these is that the disease suspends its sitting in the belly if it is necessary, and you touch the hairs of the eye, and lift the eyelash with your hand, and then collect the nail with a little pincher and extend that to the parts under.</end_of_turn
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and enter into that a hair of horse or of cat or of ox, or something similar, or strong thread, or double the extremity of the needle little by little and keep that in the middle of the nail, and pierce that with the needle, and tie that with thread; and extend that to the parts under, and scrape with the skin the part of the nail that surrounds the pupil.</end_of_turn
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And thus you should seize her with your hand at the back of her thighs.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you should pierce her with your instrument at the root of the tear duct, either with a blunt needle or small forceps, and withdraw the natural tear from the tear duct so that at the beginning of this there is no further discharge of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And when the nail has become soft on the sole of the foot, as we have said, then you should evacuate it with a sponge of the kind that we have mentioned.
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And take care that the sponge does not touch the cornea and that you avoid bursting it, and that the pupil is pierced.</start_of_turn>
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then return the incision with a pinch of coarse salt or by rubbing with fat, and withdraw that which has entered on the other side; and care for that which is inside so that it should heal.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail is not nervous and you are unable to insert the needle, or if it has not penetrated the nail, then in such a case the aforementioned kind of nail is cured with medicines, and is healed in the same way as before and as I have recommended in the division
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish to pierce her, then you must open the mouth of the patient and take sponge of the kind that we have mentioned with great speed following this fashion:
am subtilitat.	without causing harm.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if sometimes it is rare and is confused and is embraced in that place, then withdraw your hand from your eye and take sponge of the kind that we have mentioned with fat or oil or salt, and pour the sponge into the other eye the next day
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And thus repeat this operation until all that is in the eye is removed, except that which may remain in the eye, for the hand must be withdrawn from the eye, for which reason you must withdraw the sponge, and care for the eye from the beginning until it is healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And thus repeat your operation concerning that reason until it is healed
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The swelling of the tear duct, if you notice it in the eye for a long time, should be suspended on the nail; and pierce that part of it, and do not finish the incision so that no tears flow from it.</start_of_turn>

Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Certain ointments in the corners of the eye are born from a rough wound, and it is placed over the pupil, or approaches or expands over the eyelids and firmly presses the eyelids against the margins and is held together by a bandage.</start_of_turn

May the operation in the eye be that the patient's head be held steady in the chest; and take hold of the eye and collect all that rough matter on nails convenient with a forceps or a pair of tweezers; and pierce the wound at the beginning until everything is finished with the needle, and take care that you do not injure the eye during your operation.</start_of_turn
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And let your incision be like that which we have recommended in the incision of the nail, or with small forceps as these which are collected together as described in this chapter.</start_of_turn
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	So when the incision is completed and all that rough matter is removed, then fill the eye with coarse salt, or pour it in powdered form and keep it like the corrosive medicines, and rest over the eye covered with a cloth until the wound is healed.</start_of_turn

And if there remains any cause of eye irritation and it is very painful, and you fear excessive bleeding, then withdraw the sponge and care for the wound with oil until that bleeding ceases, and repeat this operation until it is healed, and keep the wound adjusted which occurs in this kind of case.</start_of_turn
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	But you must always keep in mind all the cures of the eye that are natural or accidental, or with iron, and do not put your hand on any of these operations until you see that that member is suffering from that operation.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.</start_of_turn
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of the collection of hair in the eye.</start_of_turn
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias. Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore it is necessary at the beginning to consider if the hair in which the eye is dark and not another ailment is strong, and if so, then you must remove that hair.</start_of_turn

o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or so two ointments gradually on a body in this fashion:

Note that you should not lead the air to the extremities of the sponge; and if your operation is in the morning giving it light, and if you are firm in your operation do not injure anything except those veins.</start_of_turn>
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel. Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if you are not able to collect it all in that hour, then you must place all that remains with that which causes the pain, and keep them for a few days until the pain has ceased and the swelling has subsided.</start_of_turn

Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	Of the reduction of arthritis to the nose.</start_of_turn
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you have cured the arthritis with cautery or acute medicine, when it has been foretold that it is not healed, do not be zealous in it, but make an incision over the maturity of the wound, and extract all the moisture that is in it until the bone is discovered.</start_of_turn
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And thus when the bone is discovered, sometimes in corruption or blackness, the hour you burn it with a torment of this kind:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is called rough head, and be made without fear, and the head be rounded thus as if pierced with a needle, in this manner (as it is in the following form).</start_of_turn

Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	The triangular portion of the limb is extended forward towards the limb thus as sometimes it is.</start_of_turn

And thus rest that over the bone, and that from the lacrimal; and lengthen your hand a little of the belly, and thus rotate your hand over the limb until you have pierced all the bone, and that you feel the patient sigh because he finds relief when you take away your hand.</start_of_turn

Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.</start_of_turn>
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of the reduction of the swelling of the belly.</start_of_turn

Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.</start_of_turn>
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	Of the incision of the prominence of the tough membrane of the uvula.

When there is a disruption in the tough membrane of the uvula, and it is prominent and projects outside the eyelids like a grain of sand, and it is necessary to make an incision, then the operation in this case is as follows: enter the needle at the root of the uvula from the outside inwards, and then insert the needle again at the place where there is a double fold of the lacrimal membrane, and make that penetrate and withdraw the first needle according to its position; and then insert the needle into the place of the double fold and bring out the part of the uvula in the circle of the needle, and tighten that part.</start_of_turn>
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then withdraw the needle and place over the swollen area infused with fat and wait until the thread comes loose from the bone.

And sometimes it is necessary to make an incision around the whole circumference of the tough membrane within the swollen area, and when the incision has been made with the sharp instrument that comes from the front of the wound, let out the fatty moisture, and the wound will sink down and enter as much as possible.</start_of_turn
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And tighten until it is healed.</start_of_turn>
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.</start_of_turn
De curacio de alconati.	Of the treatment of gonorrhea.</start_of_turn
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This disease which is called gonorrhea is not anything other than a swelling which is similar to water descending and is not like that.</start_of_turn
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	Moreover, the method of working in it is that you make the disease subside over the painful area and draw out the head towards the buttocks, and when you see that the swelling has gone down to the lower parts, and that it is dry and does not descend, and that it is firm, the disease will be cured in this way as well.</start_of_turn
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not go down there, you know that it is water.</start_of_turn
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	Moreover, if it is not prepared, the descent of the swelling with water, as we have said, then do so by making an incision over the tarsal bone at the junction of the conjunctiva and the cornea in the crown (within the area of the white of the eye), until the swelling is expelled.</start_of_turn

Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.</start_of_turn
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the treatment of the water descending from the wound.</start_of_turn
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said the species of water in the division and what is convenient to perforate with a needle, and when according to the state of health.</start_of_turn
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Moreover, you must make the wound subside over the buttocks and hold the wound firmly.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre. E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel. E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And now pierce the belly of the patient and sit down, since it has already been affected by the cold.

And measure the distance from the navel to the pupil, which is the diameter of the eye; for you will see the pupil with the vision of the eye through the clarity of the cornea.</end_of_turn>
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And then withdraw the abdomen into the belly, and place your hand over it again, and thus if the water descends too much, the pain which caused the patient to complain will be relieved, as soon as the water goes out of the eye which was causing the pain, and the vision returns to normal.</end_of_turn>
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And rest a little while; thus if the water has descended, withdraw that other cushion which was put under the abdomen when the water was being let out.</end_of_turn
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And thus when it is quiet and does not descend, withdraw the abdomen easily; and gently move your hand around; and dissolve in the water a little of clear salt of gem, and with that wash the eye outwards; and then remove the eye bandage or stop or dressing infused in olive oil and vinegar and water from the eye.</end_of_turn
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But we must also know what is proper concerning food at this time, and keep it on the eye.</end_turn>
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if you do not heed your abdomen when it enters the eye due to its hardness – for some men whose eyes are hard like this – then cover that you take the sponge which is called alberid, which is the shape of this:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And thus pierce that membrane there, do not put your hand in the wound, and do not do anything else until the abdomen has gone out from the eye safely.</end_turn
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then extract the abdomen as we have said.</end_turn>
