Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When the tooth must be eradicated because it is fractured, keep the surrounding area around the wound still for a day or two until the area is softened; and in the meantime apply an emollient or dressing to the area which is like the beak of a heron called ciconia or guanta, the form of the forceps:</end_of_turn
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The nails of those instruments are useful as well as lime or aloe.</end_of_turn
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey my order with these forceps or nails, keep in mind that you must give up the reason and uncover all the flesh and insert the instrument which has no name, so it is a small lever whose form is like this:</end_of_turn
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And be of short handle large and wide a little, and do not be afraid that it is broken.</end_of_turn
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if the reason for the pain is excessive heat, it is not good; but if so, help me with other instruments, of which these are the forms: the form of the first instrument is triangular, emitted in which there is any thickness.
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it is triangular and has a pointed extremity
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And already I have helped with this instrument having two slopes of which this is the form accordingly:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and other instruments which I will enumerate in order of their teeth; for the help of this instrument which is assembled like a large bowl, and this is the form:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular extremity either round or short, which is any thickness, and which is not flattened so as to be broken
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And so are the other instruments of the teeth more or less like the others
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	More skilled are the artificers and learned in the art, they find for themselves various means according to what they understand of the operation and the various diseases; for these diseases of which the ancients did not say or even name their own instruments, for the forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	More if the bone of the jaw or of the other bones of the mouth is fractured, or if they are loosened, then the foot should be kept carefully in that place where it is convenient for the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help me with managing this which is the form
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And it is of any great or small size, and is bound or held with the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the bone is completely healed; and then restore the place with appropriate medicines at that time
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	More if in the bone is a little wound, then scratch that from that wound and from its blackness, and care for that until it is healed
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the care of the teeth eminent over the others
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth are prominent not according to their natural course for those of this shape is jagged, and especially when it comes to the women, and especially to the beloved; therefore you must consider: if the tooth is not at all close to another tooth, and it is not possible to ligate or support it, then leave it as it is; but if it is not annexed to another tooth, then you should apply this instrument of which this is the form; and it is like a pig's jaw, and is made of Indian steel of extramitted not sharp.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your incision be at the place where you are applying that in a few days for the hardness of the tooth, and that it is not like the others of the teeth
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the prominent tooth is exposed to filing, then file that with a file of Indian steel of which this is the form:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it must be of Indian steel and the mark must be clearly seen; and it must be like a file with which needles are made, with which the tooth is to be filed little by little in a few days with ease, so that no other tooth is damaged or falls out
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And return the thread to the end, and scratch that from the corners of the wounds.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth from which a part is fractured and the tongue is led, then cover that until the expectation of that fragment is over and it is equalized, and it is to be filled so that the tongue does not burn or the word does not corrupt
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of teeth decayed with gold or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When the teeth before with concussion and removal by percussion or extraction, and the disease does not subside over what is eaten, and you have cured that with medicinal substances, and it has not been of any use, then so that they do not fall out is necessary to make an inlay of gold and not of silver, for silver turns green and soon becomes poor in a few days, whereas gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the gold be of such fineness and thickness as is necessary to enter between the teeth; and the form of the restoration is that you take the gold and take twice its thickness between two healthy teeth, and that it grows between two curves of the gold between two decayed teeth, or if one or two, until the fabric reaches the healthy tooth of the other side
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the thread inside the part from which you started, and strengthen your hand with ease and wisdom until it is not decayed.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your stroke be with which you strengthen the gold be over the roots of the teeth so that it does not escape
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And immediately cut away the superfluous parts surrounding the forceps or tonsils, and add them to each part of the body, and convert them and the hidden ones between the sound tooth and the bad tooth, so that they do not cause damage to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And immediately remove that which extends as far as Rome.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	More if it is slipped or swollen, stretch that or those to the other side in such a way at all times
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the rectification of two sound teeth and two bad teeth, as sometimes these are bound:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when a tooth or two are returned, immediately close the sockets in which they were, and let them recede as we have recommended, and that they remain closed
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And do not do anything but a good craftsman and a wise man.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	Every ulcer is suitable for any cause of bone disease, and it is useful for them as a remedy as regards the formation of teeth, and is placed in the place where the tooth is lacking, and is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves in that place for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the ligament which is in the tongue and prevents that which is spoken
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which is left behind the tongue has some ulcers or is natural to it which a man does not know, or accidentally caused by plague which has already hardened
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation in it is that you burn the mouth of the patient, remove all that exists in the belly; and elevate the tongue, and immediately cut that ligament nerves as much as necessary until the tongue is freed from its retraction.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	More if in that there is any hardness or denudation, and that which is left for the consolidation of plague, when you have cut once you will split that for the width until you have cut through the ligament and the nodulation has been dissolved
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And take care that there be no excessive fissure in the preparation of the flesh and that you cut here with a pointed instrument and go away from the blood flow of the saint
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And immediately wash away the remnants of the incision with oil or wine or with cold water; and immediately stop leaving the tongue loose; so that it does not solidify with any ulcer.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	More if there is blood flow from the veins, stop over the wounded area with a soaked cloth; more if the blood boils, when you have cauterized the area with the cautery which you have previously recommended.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And immediately take care of the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of wisdom from leaving the tongue
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some ulcers happen to leave the tongue swollen resembling a small hill which hinders the natural operation of the tongue; and when it has become inflamed it is greatly increased until the mouth is dry
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation in it is that you burn the mouth of the patient sitting before the sun and consider the swelling
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if sometimes you see a yellow or black spot, hard, to which the patient feels no sensation, then do not touch that which is rotten.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined to whiteness, in which there is moisture, then immediately put on the thumb in it, and cut that with a sharp instrument, and cut off all of it; and if there is blood flow from the wound during the operation, immediately stop it by pressing the bleeding, so that it is not dry, until the blood has clotted
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And immediately return to your work until you have completed it, until it has been washed with wine and salt; and take care of that which is left of the other care until it is healed
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XVI
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of the wisdom from two ears and that which is nothing in the gullet and from the other wisdoms
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When it is swollen in the gullet, so are the glands which are assembled together and which are outside and are not nourished by two ears, which when you cure with water as we have said in the division and it is not healed, then you consider if the wisdom is hard, of yellow color, with little sensation, then do not touch that which is rotten
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a brown color and the reason is large, then do not touch that which is rotten for the flow of blood; remove that which is soft, and you either extract that or it will break by itself
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	If it is pale in color, radon, and the reason is subtle, then that is that it is likely an injury.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	If you consider the patient's condition, giving an account of your operation, if the swelling has subsided or diminished in any way; then do you cause the patient to cough strongly, turn their head to the side, and open their mouth, while the attendants grasp between their thighs according to the patient's tongue, leaving an instrument of noble kind in their hand.</end_of_turn>
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	Whether of silver or gold, and subtle as a coat.</end_of_turn>
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Thus, when you promise this to the patient and show them the swelling, and touch that which is in the abdomen, then take hold once and leave the other in its place, and pull the other outwards as much as you can.</end_of_turn
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	The other thing that you pull is any cause of the tunics, and in this way you apply that instrument of which I have spoken.
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is joined like forceps, however the extremities of it are bent, so that the orifice of each one is at the end of the other, not acute, which is of iron without a bevel.</end_of_turn
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	Or if this instrument is not at hand, then apply that which is like a sponge: and be acute from one side, not from the other side.</end_of_turn>
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And having incised one wound, then the other is to be incised in the same manner as the first wound, and then keep the wound closed with water from a jug.</end_of_turn
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Or if there flows forth pus, keep water of decoction of poppy seed or of chamomile flower and remain as I have said of the causes mentioned above until the flow of the pus is restrained, and take care of that which remains until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And many herbs grow in the ground, other swellings, others two carbuncles, and these are to be incised as I have said above concerning the incision of two wounds together.</end_of_turn
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a woman with swelling in the groin who was lying in the ground of the field, who had swelling which tended towards a dark color, little sensation, which already closed the field of the groin, and the woman breathed with great difficulty, and had been forbidden food and drink of water, and was on the verge of death if more days had passed for a day or two.</end_of_turn>
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	The swelling had already become so great that there were two fist-sized holes between which the surgeon had to pass two fingers.</end_of_turn
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore I must cut fistulately and remain with one of them once, and pull out the other, and when it is pulled out, I take away from it a great part, and I apply that which I have mentioned concerning the incision of the other hole, and I open the mouth of it, and I compress its tongue, and I remain with the finger in the wound.</end_of_turn
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And I take away a great part of it, and there runs from it only a little pus.</end_of_turn
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore the groin of that woman is absolutely saved, and she begins to drink water so soon, and I do not cease to incised that swelling until much time has passed, and there follows swelling in its place, which I must also incised as long as that lasts.</end_of_turn
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I went and cauterized the groin of her, so as to avoid infection; and I remained there and did not depart until I had beheld that from God.
Capitol .xxxvii.	The end of the text.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	From the incision of the heel when it is swollen.</end_of_turn>
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the heel becomes soft and is swollen and is long, then it is not called perpendicular; and if it is in the outer part large and round, and then it is called bubble.</end_of_turn
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	Or when it is cured with the water that we have said in the division, and you do not neglect your care, sometimes the swelling will go away and be subtle, when the time has come; and if it is at that length, and there is blood, of a yellow or black color, and it is not to its centimeter, then you must fear the incision, for in that case there is fear of the patient.</end_of_turn
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner that I have said of its paleness and length, that you must make the patient cough and praise the tongue with the instrument of which we have spoken concerning its shape, and you remain with the finger in the wound and pull out the other.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And know that you should only insert that which is adjusted according to the natural tendency of the limb, for if you insert too much, you will cause them to swell.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And if you insert, use of that which we have recommended in the incision of two incisions, and take care that it is sound.</end_of_turn>
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	More if the ailment is spread by the incision, cover that you use an engine in the cautery of it for fear, and the manner of handling the cautery is nothing but acute water, and it is that you hold the patient's head still, and immediately take hold of the tongue with the instrument that we have mentioned, and immediately pour water that we have mentioned in the chapter of cautery, and comfort her with that cause life, and stop that from spreading or becoming soft, and from that fill the cavity of the instrument which is like this:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Or the evacuation of the cavity in which the medicine has been placed just like the cavity of a bowl of ray, and hold the instrument with the medicine on the lip, and the patient will spit over the side of the lip so that saliva or mucus from the mouth of that for the intrinsic medicine, so that it does not remain from that cause any cause on the palate of him and that he evacuate that.</end_of_turn>
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And immediately put your hand on the medicine, and press that against the uvula for a space of a minute until it has become softened and calmed by the bite of the medicine.</end_of_turn>
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a sponge and cover that over the limb of the ray, and immerse the sponge in the medicine, and put the ray on the sponge in a tube so that the sponge adheres to that tube, and do that for as long as you wish until you achieve what you desire from the cautery of the toe, and immediately stop that so that it dries up and falls off within three days or four.</end_of_turn>
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you think that the medicine should be repeated, repeat that, and immediately stop the cautery from spreading in the circuit of the toe at the base of the nail, and modify that which is in the circuit of the medicine, and let it be washed with fresh water, and let it be cured with ointment, and let him rest until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is more saving than incision and more lasting for fear.</end_of_turn>
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some women are cured of the ulcer with that which is more subtle than cautery and incision, which is cured by fumigation in this manner: prescribe calamine, rue, origium, ruda, bitter almonds, chamomile, broth and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all these causes, or some of them, in a wave, and let them be submerged in strong vinegar, and bubble; and the wave be given to her to drink adequately, and in the middle of the wave put a bandage, over which is placed an instrument of copper according to this manner; let it be made of silver or copper.</end_of_turn
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let her put her limb into the mouth of the patient until the vapor makes the uvula rest on the canula, until the uvula is not opaque.</end_of_turn
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And immediately repeat that until it is dry, and take care that you do not perform this treatment at the beginning of an attack, because it would be too strong for the attack, and do not say that you are performing it, but declare that it is the cautery.</end_of_turn
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	More if you do not have this instrument at hand, then take a tube and apply to the limb of the ray a piece of sponge, so that the mouth of the patient is cleaned, because the sponge of the sponge prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.</end_of_turn
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.</end_of_turn>
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of extractions of splinters and that which adheres to the palate and the other causes.</end_of_turn
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	A splinter or any other cause adheres to the palate or nail of the foot or any other cause.</end_of_turn
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then cover that you extract that which is apparent, on which you cast your gaze, for because you touch the tongue with the instrument that has a sole, so that you are told that that which is in the throat.</end_of_turn
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which is not apparent and is hidden in the throat, cover that you make the patient vomit the patient before the food is digested in the stomach, for that strengthens the cause that is annexed to the throat if it is forced out by vomiting; or that he swallow the patient one spoonful of honey or radish or a piece of bread soaked in vinegar; or give him to drink one spoonful of sea sponge soaked in oil and bind that firmly with faith, and immediately give the patient that, for when it gets to the place where the thorns are and is extracted, the patient will have forgotten it.</end_of_turn
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	If these causes have not been forgotten, then use a lead instrument in this way: ...
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	Make it thicker than a small ray, and in the extraction of it there should be a concavity which you will put into its groove easily
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And elevate the heel of the patient slightly, and keep your hand from the heel of the limb to the groin, so that it does not touch the intestines or the bone, or that the hand of the physician should be on the chest.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	However, when the patient is in pain, for his knowledge of the place of the underlying cause and the pain that is in it, and pulls his hand towards the instrument in his hand, as much as he is prepared to do so until it is forgotten
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.</start_of_turn>
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of a blood vessel that is attached to the groin.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the blood vessel has been treated with what has been said in the division of the cure with medicines and has not been relieved, consider the time of the patient in the groin towards the sun, because you have compressed the tongue of the patient with the instrument that we have recommended
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if the blood vessel has sometimes burst, extract that one little or slightly bent downwards adequately.</start_of_turn>
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it, take a curved needle and insert it into the groin of the patient, and when you have placed it in the cavity of the needle put a burning iron on the concavity of the needle, and do this for as long as the blood vessel is dead and is not hindering the groin.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And keep a vessel filled with cold water nearby, and open its mouth in that place, and wash the mouth with that; and do not do anything else with that, but keep the water there for an hour or two with your hand, until the blood vessel has recovered as much as the water has cooled down.</start_of_turn>
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	However, if it is not forgotten as we have recommended, keep the patient calm by hand or by means of an instrument that we have recommended in the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it will fall.</start_of_turn
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	This is another way of operating in the fumigation of that, that you take a bowl in which there are burning coals and cover the bowl with a cover, and there is a hole in the middle of the cover, and put the extremity of the instrument in that hole; and when the smoke has gone down, open the patient’s mouth at the extremity of the needle, and close the patient’s mouth so that the smoke is not blown out until you know that the smoke has reached the blood vessel, because the blood vessel must have fallen down.</start_of_turn
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall, repeat the fumigation many times, and abstain the patient from drinking, and give them salty foods and drinks, and do not give them water, and if necessary, take them away from this regimen.</start_of_turn
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the instrument with which the blood vessel of the groin is treated when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps in this way, but it is in any curvature: ...
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	...which is similar to the groin, and the extremity of it is similar to the beak of a heron, which is hooked, in which it is grasped from five, so that when any cause is compressed, that does not slip away.</start_of_turn
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.</start_of_turn
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the word in the opening of the abscesses and in the section of their.</start_of_turn
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The abscesses are of various kinds, of various methods, as you remember from this book.</start_of_turn
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are various in perforation and section of them by two methods, of which one is for the species of abscesses in themselves; and for what compresses of the humors.</start_of_turn
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is for the places where the accidents of the body occur, for the abscess that happens in the head is different from the abscess that happens in the buttocks; and the abscess in the fleshy part happens differently from the abscess that happens in the joint; and each one of them must be treated differently.</start_of_turn
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	The wound should not be pierced except in the mature parts of the limb or as a consequence of it.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other wounds which are crossed should be cut when mature, not according to their size, just like those which are proper for the joints, for an apostema which appears in a joint remains there until it is forced out; and if it is too strong, it corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, because it is a cause of contraction of that limb; or if the apostema is that of a principal limb, and you delay the perforation of it until it is mature, it does not harm the principal limb; or if it is that of the heel, therefore perforate only when it is not mature; and do not perforate carelessly, except for the one which is proper for the heel, in order that you do not weaken the heel and that it is elongated towards the base of the heel, and that there is a fistula, or that it is healed in the end without being healthy.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	It is better that you know the time of perforation of the apostema, and that is when it is mature.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	You know that it is mature when the pain and fever cease, and also the diminishing of redness and pulse, and the acuteness of the head of the apostema, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you must know that the perforation must be made in the place where the apostema comes out and where its neck comes from.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	The perforation should always be done along the length of the limb or the body, if the aposmata is in the parts of the feet or the legs, and in the place of the lacertices, of the cords of the nerves, of the arteries; and finally in all the places where there is no reflection; for in those where there is reflection, use perforation according to that limb.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	When the aposmata is in a fleshy place, it is more convenient to delay the perforation until the digestion of the limb has been confirmed according to custom, as we have said; for if you perforate it before that, it prolongs the pain of the limb and its swelling, and it makes the lips of the limb stiff and deep
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	Other aposmata must be pierced according to the width of the limb or of the body as necessity requires, or as the limb itself demands.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you must give a small perforation, and in large aposmata give great perforation or several sections according to the variety of the size of the aposmata.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And in other aposmata where the cord is concave and inflamed, when it is necessary because it is painful like bread and painful in the end that it should stay, just like that which happens in the groin of the buttocks and the armpits
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And in those which are inscribed with three angles; and in those which are inscribed like the figure of a mirta leaf, like the aposmata of the ankle bones
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And in those which are administered round section and lunar section, and which resemble these.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	And in those which are not capable of such things like external aposmata, you must pierce only the superficial perforation, or only the flat one alone
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the aposmata is large and has already collected much pus, that you pierce it and do not hesitate to extract all the pus at that moment; having extracted a part of it, immediately put the aposmata back into its place the next day, and the next day extract a greater part, and do this gradually until it is healed
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And more if the illness is of cold origin, or of hot and cold, or a young child, or an old man in decrepitude, for the vital heat is resolved by the evacuation of the pus, and thus the illness is cured, and you must operate quickly.</end_of_turn>
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Keep this chapter with great care, and take great care with your perforation in which you pierce these aposmata, because you must remove the humors and consider therefore if the humors of the aposmata are few or are flat, when you administer the which ones or the amount of them; and if the aposmata is large, and the tears of the perforation are many, you must pause for a moment until they settle down.</end_of_turn>
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the aposmata a part of the cord is detached or that you have concaved in the circuit, you must complex it with cloth or thread of silk, just like when you have treated bones or cartilage, its humidity; and strengthen that within the third day; and immediately after process that and care for it until the inflammation has disappeared.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	And if blood flows out in the hour of your operation, immediately administer cold water and vinegar in which you have soaked a piece of cloth, and stop that over the area of the flow of blood until the bleeding has stopped.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	May it be so that the flow of the sacred things persevere, for it is necessary that you administer regiment and care, and powders as I have recommended in many places of this present book and of division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is wintertime, and the seat of the apostem is of nerves, then you must instill powders in wine and oil, and leave them on the area.</end_of_turn>
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If it is summer, and the parts are fleshy, then you must leave powders in vinegar with oil or in wine and oil, and do so until the third day, as we have said, and you must remove the apostem and evacuate it, and administer to it the cure that is necessary for it until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of apostemas universally, more so according to the way of distinction that I have already said of every apostem in what manner it is a way of the care of it by chapters singly.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xli.	Chapter LXI.</end_of_turn>
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of apostemas which are in the codena of the head.</end_of_turn
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the small head there are small apostemas, and so of species of knots which contain tunics that are made for them; and the species of these are soft.</end_of_turn
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of these there are bubbles, and of those there are those that contain humidity similar to lime.</end_of_turn
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those there are those that contain humidity similar to urine, and resembling them; and of those that are waxy.</end_of_turn
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of these, there is no fear, as you must know the extension of these does not do harm to the arteries.</end_of_turn
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of these is that you remove them with an instrument of the kind that you see, which is called entromes, until you know that it contains.</end_of_turn
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what is contained is humidity, then you must cut that apart by section according to the length by superficial section according to this manner:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin in the section of the line of B, entering into the line of G. For when the humidity is evacuated, then you must scrape that from which that humidity was contained, and do not leave from that any cause of all, for the troops that were fleeing return if they remain from that cause.</end_of_turn
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then you will immerse the wound in Egyptian unguents, if present, or in water and salt; and fill that with that the wound and leave that until the next day, for that which is eaten away corrodes all that remains of that membrane.</end_of_turn

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the incision of abscesses which occur by artery or vein.</end_of_turn
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured, and the cord which is above that is solidified, which is the cause of the abscess, it is known that inflammation and abscess are caused by the artery or vein: for when the abscess is caused by an artery, it is long aggregated in the belly of the body; and when it is caused by a vein, sit on it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is caused by a vein is round as the body manifests.</end_of_turn

And the incision of this abscess is wrong, especially in those who leave the heels, and the buttocks, and the groin, and in many parts of the body; and it is not great, therefore command that its cure by iron be avoided, and that which is in the extremities, or at the head, be avoided.</end_of_turn

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Praise be to the care of the Most High of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The navel is useful for many causes; or for fractures of the ribs which are above the belly, and yeys of them the cloth or the intestine according as it happens in other ruptures; or for healing which flows from veins or arteries as it is said above, or for cramps caused by excessive wind in the belly.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	And if it is for a fracture of the ribs and for yanking of the cloth, the hour the color of the urine is similar to the color of the body; and is like a lion when it is in pain, and appears in various positions
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is for the escape of the intestine, the hour its situation is that which we have recounted, of may be of various kinds, and as you have said that which is hidden from us is occultated, and so return; and it is strong in that place, and is increased by many blows of the hand and violent work
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	And if it is for moisture, the hour is like a lion and is not occultated when we put our hand on it, nor is it constricted, nor is it painful.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is for healing, the hour this symptom disappears the urine appears dark and declining
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	And if it is for meat nothing, the hour is dark urine, thick and harsh, and remains according to a quantity
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	And if it is for wind, the hour it touches them is like a lion
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in them is that you consider the hour if the navel is for the healing of an artery or a vein or for wind; the hour forbids you to take care of it, because in that case there is fear and anxiety just as we have taught you in the chapter where we said that the urine is for an artery and a vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the navel is for the intestine or for the cloth, the hour commands the patient who has the pain to sit still and be relaxed; and command him to lie down on the navel; and command him to put two hands over the patient’s legs and two hands over the patient’s chest; and command him to extend the palm of the hand over the place where you have marked with your finger; and command him to grasp the great toe firmly or weakly and with a gentle touch
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And so hold the heel of the palm extended over the ligament and insert the tip of the finger into that place and ask for the intestine; and if you have found it neither grasped nor preserved for the ligament, the hour you will extract the intestine and expel the intestine to the parts under the belly
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the cloth, the hour take that one with your hand; and cut away the excess of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	And if it is contrary to your artery or vein, the hour surrounds that thing, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put them in those two strong fields and insert two needles into the circuit which you have made around the urine in the manner of a cross, which you will pierce; and then strengthen the urine in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, keep the needles and rest the place until the meat extends and falls off by itself; or cut that when it is subtle and it falls down, and so care for that which covers the wounds until it is healed.

La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The way of the forceps for modification is as follows:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment. Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	More, the error in modification is that if you force too much you will expel the intrinsic cord entirely, or part of it from the incision.</end_of_turn

Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retained urine in the bladder is caused by excessive population, for stone or for sand, or for poverty or for meat, and it remains like those which we have said concerning the methods of care in the division.</end_of_turn

Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	An inguinal hernia is nothing but the accumulation of moisture in the white sac which contains the intestines and is called a sac.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	There are several veins in the proper bowel which nature has prepared in the part of the intestines, until it is complete; and that is the cord of the genetius between the white sac which we have mentioned, and it is not water but bile.</end_of_turn

I say that one should make the patient lie on a high cushion; and then insert the sperm of the testicles to the lower parts; and take hold of the testicles with the hands that are to be verified; and have those other ministers that you have, and extend those with violent extension.</end_of_turn

De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Capital .lxv.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The origin of this hernia is by incision that extends over the abdomen from the flanks of the navel, so that the intestines coming from the rupture are intermingled with the abdominal fat.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	Or this rupture is of the bladder or of excess of gas, and these two things happen for various causes: either by percussion, or by swallowing, or by straining, or by elevation of any serious cause, or by remaining in a sitting position for a long time
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	The sign of this is that if it is an extension of the bladder, it happens slowly over a long time, and does not happen abruptly, and the edema subsides within a few days without any treatment.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	The sign of this is that if it is an incision of the bladder, at the beginning it causes severe pain immediately; and it is edema that makes the belly appear swollen, and this is because of the displacement of the intestine by the tumor of the bladder against the walls of the abdomen
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	Therefore every physician must know how to treat this hernia of the intestines immediately, because it is an urgent thing that must not be delayed
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	Some physicians are of the opinion that the cause of this hernia is excessive wind, others that it is caused by a wound in the intestine, and here it is retained, and it is in this way that it causes great suffering, and other physicians say that it is caused by violent vomiting and mostly when it is accompanied by pain
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of this disease there is fear, for that one must fear that it will escape from the physician's grasp in that moment.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	The way of operating in this case is that you command the patient to reduce the swelling of the belly with their hand to the extent that they can bear, and if they obey your order, then put a wet compress over the area between their thighs and hold their legs up.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And then close the opening which is between the testicles and the skin, and suture the opening of the testicles all the way through; and at the end of the suture close the two lips of the incision as much as you wish to open the incision with those things
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if the opening is large as you are able, that from that one must not forget the dressing of the wound
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	And immediately remove from that area the phlegmas which are left in the opening of the testicles, until the white hard membrane of some part is discovered.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then you must empty the intestine called in this case testicles, between the white membrane which is left in the opening of the intestines, which is left in the opening of the wound, and the membrane which is between them, and remove from that the adhesion which is in the back of the wound
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And finally put your hand over the opening of the testicles at the edges, and with your left hand extend the white membrane towards your hand, and elevate the intestine with the membrane towards the incision; and command the assistant to extend the intestine outwards and you dissolve the adhesion that is behind with a solution accomplished
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And seek that there be no cause for the swelling of the belly covered with the white hard membrane.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	Maybe you will find some cause of this in the belly that you left behind
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And take a needle on which is strong enough to make a hole of about four threads, and insert that into the belly which is under the opening of the testicles, which is the one you left open; and when you have inserted it through four threads, remove the needle and pass the two ends through the hole so that they make a cross; and tie them together with the two threads that remain on either side of the wound
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And cover the ends of the threads and tie them together with strong thread so that no vessel which has been injured in that place can cause any cause for this to happen again
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And wait another hour before closing the wound, about three times that of the first; and then join two threads which you leave from the abdomen which is left open at the amount of the size of the thumb, and insert them through all the remaining parts according to the roundness, and keep them there for a while.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And finally insert inside the opening of the testicles for the incision of which we have spoken, so that there runs blood and air out of it as we have recommended above
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And give a soaked bandage in oil, and wait on the wound; and administer the thread which we have recommended (and several physicians cauterize the white membrane of the abdomen, which we have mentioned above in order to prevent the flow of blood, because many physicians say that these happen in those).
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	May it be that despite the delay of the case, the hour of cold water is opportune, and pause until it falls as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And thus treat the plague with the other care of the plagues until it is healed

De castracio.	Of castration
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Wisdoms that castration is prohibited in our law, however I remember it in this book; and it is not necessary to recall it except for two cases, of which one is that the physician should know the care of it when it is questioned about it, since he knows the care of it to which it corresponds; and the other case is that we must sometimes castrate other animals for our judgments for those, as well as mares, and sows, and goats, and for such like beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is useful in two ways: or by traction, or by incision at section
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	May be in that which is causing the pain, the way of the work is that we must make them cease the beast in cold water until the veins of them become softened and limp and that they hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And immediately take hold of them with your hand so that they do not appear to touch them again
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	May be in castration there is pain for fracture and section, cover that you have the beast and press the testicles of them with your left hand
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And immediately bind the supporters, and pierce concerning any humor on a section until two humors proceed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And immediately pierce those which have been scorched
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not let them be about those of the hips any cause, but the subtle hip which is above the veins
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this manner of castration is better than that which is for attrition, because attrition strong would leave any cause of the testicles so that the beast would desire to bite
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And immediately care for the plague until it is healed

De la cura de hermafrodozia.	On the care of hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is according to two methods: the one is when it appears that the space between the testicles is cut off in that place where between two testicles appears what looks like a woman in which one can insert.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And many women of that age urinate in the space between the testicles
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	And in women it is a kind: and it is that the known woman about the fifth is like two testicles of a man a little big and a little small at the end like two testicles of a man and two testicles
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the care is of three kinds: two of the men and one of the women
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is that you put your hands on those parts that are adjusted until you drive out the sign of that, and immediately care for those with care for the other diseases
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second kind of the men of whom we have spoken who urinate in the space between the testicles, there is no care or operation in them
