E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And keep your prudence in the incision of a vein or a nerve, or a string, and administer skill in every way possible to facilitate the escape of the needle; and do that with such ease and tranquility and moderation as I and you have recommended
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	Therefore you must oppose the needle so that the disease is according to the figure according to which you must treat the case of the needle in it, for that is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	Maybe if that is not possible for you, the hour commands you to administer what is possible for you according to the figures
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	The wound has gone beyond the normal limits of the other side, or already proceeds from one side to the other side, or causes swelling of the limb from the root up to the elbow; therefore you should draw back from that; and make the incision according to the quantity in which the forceps are grasped.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is retained in the bone, then draw the limb along the opposite side until the arrowhead touches the bone, and expand it further inwards, and then extract it.</end_of_turn>
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Or leave it for a few days, and then try to extract it again.</end_of_turn>
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the arrowhead is firmly fixed in that place, then pierce it through with your thumb.</end_of_turn
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	Or if it is stubborn and you wish to give it another impulse, then insert your hand inside and, if it is silent, touch its concavity against the side of the arrow and then pierce it through with your thumb.</end_of_turn>
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	Or if the arrow is curved, then pierce it through with your thumb from the inside outwards, because the arrow is relieved by that.</end_of_turn
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then you must cover all the surrounding flesh with something, if possible, and then take care of the wound as you deem necessary.</end_of_turn>
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow has penetrated the foot, or the belly, or the bladder, or the side, and is close enough to do so, grasp the wound with your hand and, if possible, draw it out.  If it breaks, cover the wound with a bandage and keep your hand over the area to prevent any further bleeding or nerve damage.  Then extract the arrow and, if necessary, close the wound when it has healed.</end_of_turn>
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which arrows are grasped:</end_turn
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their handles are like the beak of an owl, which are useful when they grasp the arrow so that it does not slip.</end_turn
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And there are various kinds of forceps, large, small, medium, according to the quantity of the size of the arrow and its thinness, and the width of the wound, and the constriction of the area.</end_of_turn
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Method of grasping the wound inwards like a claw of an owl to alleviate the tension of the arrow in it, and pushing inwards with that hand:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Method of pushing inwards with the hand.</end_turn
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Like this to relieve the tension of the arrow inwards and push it inwards.</end_turn
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of venipuncture.</end_turn
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins from which we usually take blood for phlebotomy are usually...</end_turn of which there are sixteen in total.</end_turn There are two pulse veins that are close to the ankles, called the tibial veins; two veins that are in the two temples which are called the temporal veins; two veins that are in two holes of two nails which are called the lachrymal veins; a vein that is in the middle of the forehead; a vein that is at the end of the nose; two veins that are at the collarbone; two veins that are in the lips above; two veins that are in the lips below; and these are called the palpebral veins; and there are two veins that are below the tongue.</end_turn
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	The veins that are punctured in the armpits are worth five.</end_turn And the cephalic vein, which is the armpit vein, is worth five because it is the mother of all the veins, and it is blind, and is called the “root vein”, and it is a medium-sized vein, and it is composed of a branch of the basilica and another branch of the cephalic; and people call it the “trunk of the body”, and the basilica vein is the one that is stopped in the armpit, and is called the “cephalic vein of the armpit”, and the one that is on the forearm is called the “radial vein”, and it is stopped over the elbow, and this is the one that appears on the surface for a visible sign; and the brachial vein, which is between the thumb and the little finger, and there are two branches in it.</end_turn
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and the leg there are three veins; one of them is the one that is below the curvature of the little bone of the armpit; and the second is the saphenous vein, the place of which is below the crease of the armpit; and the sciatic vein, the place of which is below the crease of the armpit; and in the leg there are other veins similar to these.</end_turn
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The nourishment of the veins that are close to the ankles is due to clots of ancient catarrh, emigration, saffosis and ulcers of the head, old evils.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And as for the quality of sleep you must know that it is related to the state of the patient: that is, that the head of the disease must be soft, and the head of the disease in the back of the head in the place where two veins are wide and well-frictioned; then strengthen the patient with a cushion between two points where the veins are close to the ankles in two places depressed from the head; and that is what I told you before, and if you sit on the side of those that I told you, here is the attempt.</end_of_turn>
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the pointed lance and that which is incidental, and introduce the vein into the codena until the blood comes out to the bone.</end_of_turn>
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then elevate your hand with the vein and the codena to the parts below and puncture the vein at the beginning of its incidence.</end_of_turn
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And the length of the puncture is the quantity of two fingers adjusted or around that; and do it quickly as much as you want.</end_of_turn>
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then strengthen with powder and leave that which is within until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already at the beginning of the treatment the puncture of those and their cauterization.</end_of_turn>
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	More of the two veins that are on the temples that help with the phlebotomy is ancient embolism and bad blood and habitual obstruction and acute swelling of the belly.</end_of_turn

And as for the quality of performing those is that I recommend to you: constrain the patient with a cushion between two points where the two veins are visible at the moment when the feeling appears and demonstrate that you have understood their situation; and if you sit on the side of those that I have told you, here is the attempt.</end_of_turn

And then elevate the limb over the vein to the parts below as I have told you, and introduce the phlebotomy incision from the outside, and elevate the vein in its place; and puncture that just as you did with the other two veins; and do the treatment according to the quantity of your need.</end_of_turn

E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And already the memory of those is recalled, and of those the puncture and the attraction at the beginning of the treatment.</end_of_turn
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore the nourishment of the phlebotomy of the vein of the forehead is similar to the phlebotomy of the cephalic vein to the ancient maladies of the face and to embolism, dropsy and fetid ulcers.</end_of_turn
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And as for the quality of the phlebotomy of those is that I recommend to you: that the patient tighten their limbs with a bandage until the vein appears; and then take the instrument called fossori of which this is the form.</end_of_turn

Pause the puncture when the tip of the fossori is on that vein and puncture it with a lean or other cause in the manner of those who do it; and let the blood run out according to the quantity you want; then remove the puncture from the patient and strengthen that which is within until it is healed.</end_of_turn
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	Many veins are open with phlebotomy, however, the phlebotomy is not of acute extremity just like the others, but rather of remote extremity, and phlebotomize that according to the traverse, because the bone is proper and strong enough to withstand the phlebotomy when it is subtle.</end_of_turn
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	More the nourishment of the two veins that are on the edges of two eyes for the scabies of the eyes for dropsy and swelling in the eyes, and to the maladies of the face.</end_of_turn
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient tighten their limb with a bandage, and then phlebotomize those, and you stay standing over their head.</end_of_turn

Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	More the phlebotomy of the vein of the nose is related to acute fever and violent sweating, and to the maladies of the face and embolism and dropsy that occur in the face, and especially when it is ancient.</end_of_turn
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	The quality of the bleeding of the patient is that the patient stretches their tongue and approaches their nose with their left hand, and takes a moderate amount of blood from the middle of the nose following a direct line, so that the vein does not appear to be affected, and the blood flows freely.

The greatest benefit of the bleeding of the two veins is to cause constriction of bile and commencement of leprosy and to abolish various diseases, such as measles, smallpox and corrosive ulcers, just as if by herpotromeno.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela. And then perform the bleeding of the vein gradually with moderate bleeding; and extract blood in a temperate quantity, or as many times as is necessary; and keep the other vein still
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada. E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident. E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And whoever wants to happen the evacuation of the arms and dissolve the blood according to each time, cover that from which the lithotomy is for the movement of evacuation, and the virtue of which is cold, which evacuates the blood little by little, so is according to the quantity of the virtue in the continuous days.</end_of_turn
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	Whoever wants to happen the evacuation of the arms, and grasp the blood according to days, and the body is strong, then do that with almost seven or eight hours of the first lithotomy.</end_of_turn
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	Whoever wants to throw out the blood of the body contrary to the part to which it declines, cover that it should be done on the second or third day.</end_of_turn
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	Whoever in the body where there is no blood already clotted and is acute and causes fever, cover that you remove from it the blood in one blow and remove a great quantity of it and amplify the opening until fainting occurs, because you have preserved all the conditions of lithotomy; and that you place your hand over the area where the vein is to be lithotomized, because if you do not do that you will endanger life instead of fainting, for there are many who are ignorant and negligent in lithotomy.</end_of_turn>
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not cover when you want to remove the arm and evacuate the sacred according to custom, as the orifice of the vein is already closed and it is difficult to extract the sacred, so that you must surpass that malice and curve excessively, for that is too bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	There remains liquid inside that is fleumatose according to custom; or remain with the acuteness of the fleumatosis which is coagulation of the sacred in the orifice of the vein; or stop over that of mercury, or saffron, and compress that until the sacred is outside and settled
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is clotted, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the clot is dissolved
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if necessity compels you to evacuate the sacred according to custom, and it is not excused, then take hold of that on that limb or in the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called “funis of the arm” is fleumatized in the place of the lymph or of the fatty tissue, when not obstructed or hidden, for it is composed of these.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the fleumatization of them is that the disease brings its hand into cold water until the cavity is softened and the vein appears manifestly
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And do the same with that ligament and stricture of the middle; and fleumatize according to the small transverse, not latitudinally or along the length
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And the opening must be wide and your fleumatization must be of the kind that you fleumatize that above the junction of the hand a little bit
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of the sacred is prohibited, then you iterate the hand in cold water and let the sacred run in the water until you achieve your need
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	More so if you are in the summer days, for in that case you are excused from iterating the hand in cold water, and the more is that the body of the sacred is kept in cold water in wintertime.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the fleumatization of this vein is more severe than all the others, for it has neither pulsating vein nor nerves
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the fleumatization of the cubital vein is related to the diseases of the foot.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the fleumatization of them is that you strengthen the hand with the ligament or with the hand itself, because you have placed it in cold water, until the vein is swollen and is shown at the same time; and do the same with the transverse; if you do not do this, it will not be cured in this way
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And take care not to touch your hand with the fleumatization, for you leave only the nerves of the fingers naked of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And do the same by iterating the hand in cold water and letting the sacred run in it, for if you do not iterate in cold water, the sacred will coagulate in the orifice of the vein, and it is prohibited to flow.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the sacred is extracted according to the quantity of need, then you stop over the vein with oil and salt, so that it is not solidified too much; and similarly cover that you may not leave any wound open
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	More useful is the fleumatization of the left hand, as it is related to the diseases of the heel.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do the same with the fleumatization of these as you have done in the other case.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The benefit of the cephalic vein in fleumatization is for the diseases that are in the lower part of the body, as well as diseases of the major veins, and retention of menses, and the diseases of the tonsils and ulcers of cavities and old wounds.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of the fleumatization of them is that the disease brings the whole foot into cold water and makes it swell over that friction until the veins appear; and it ties over the ankle joint like a cord; and the place of the vein that appears must be indicated by the thumb, and from that so branch out on the face of the foot many veins that reach the knee
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	Therefore fleumatize the most extensive branch or leave the limb without its limb, because of the adhesion of the blood to the bone is better and more salt
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you fleumatize that on the face of the foot, then you must take care of the nerves that are left over that on the face of the foot, and stop your fleumatization with the one that you fleumatize across, as if you were going to puncture it
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And do so always.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	May it be permitted that I repeat the foot in the cold water and allow the sacred liquid to flow into that which must be evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the physician errs in the first portion of the treatment, then repeat the cautery a a few times, because the place is salt; and fear not its malice, for it is better to guard the nerves as we have said.</end_of_turn>
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Likewise do the same with the other foot, equal measure.</end_of_turn>
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And as for the sciatic vein, the place we have mentioned must be grasped by the heel to leave the cavity of the hairy part.</end_of_turn
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the assistance of the cautery is to pull down the thigh when it is for the sacred cautery.</end_of_turn
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the cautery is that the patient between bouts of pain rests, and is relaxed and holds the limb from the waist down to the ankle with a long, narrow bandage that does not appear except for water.</end_of_turn
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	Therefore, when it appears, repeat the cautery according to the custom of each case and according to the situation, for it is better; or insert it by incision or remove it by excision, because the place is salt.</end_of_turn
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most homes not to be seen; and if you find it, and it does not appear to the feeling of all, repeat the cautery on some part of it, for that which appears in the two feet beyond the ear and the ankle.</end_of_turn
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	Beware of the nerves, and allow the sacred liquid to flow in the quantity you wish.</end_of_turn
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then remove the stricture and place your hand over the place of the cautery to strengthen the place, for curiosity is health.</end_of_turn
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	From the breeze and the qualities of the vinegar.</end_of_turn>
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	The winds are of corn, or of ivy, or of ivy leaves.</end_of_turn
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And the breeze is useful in two ways: one is by sacrifice and extraction of the sacred, and the other is by the breeze itself being a sacrifice.</end_of_turn
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this sacrifice that is by the breeze is in two ways, for either by fire or by fire.</end_of_turn
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the winds that are administered with sacrifice and extraction of the sacred are thirteen parts of the body, of which one is the nail of the thumb which is in the heel; and the two parts of the heel; and the two parts of the elbow; and the two parts of the wrist; and the two parts of the ankle; and two parts of the big toe; and two parts of the little toe.</end_of_turn
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And the breeze does not extract the sacred except from the small veins scattered throughout the flesh, and for this it does not take away its virtue, just as is the case with cautery; neither does it suffice that the breeze should be by fire or fire in any illness that is useful for replenishing until the whole body is evacuated.</end_of_turn
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	And if necessary, we will provoke the breeze for illness or for continuance, let us administer it at the beginning and at the end of the month, and in the middle of the month and at any time.</end_of_turn
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that in some men the sacred is multiplied within them until they find difficulty in extracting it by the breeze and they find on their head a great weight and bitterness; and from these are those who find replenishment and solace in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and from these are those who find during their face and in their front brow obscurity and confusion and sleeplessness in their knees; and from these who discharge the location of their breeze; and from these who have their laughter multiplied; and from these who find the taste of the sacred in their mouth, or that their tongue is scorched and spits out the sacred; and from these who have their sleep multiplied, and from these who see the sacred in their sleep sorrow and ancientness and plagues and other causes that remind them of it.</end_of_turn>
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Therefore, whenever in any case of these, and properly if it is in the third or middle of the month, we command that the breeze be more useful than it has been for two or three hours.</end_of_turn
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the assistance of the breeze from the neck is that when it confers to gravity in the head and descends to the knees; however, it does not suffice that it should be close to the evacuation of all the body.</end_of_turn
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this breeze is in the place of the cephalic cautery.</end_of_turn
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not permitted to use those who are excessively cold or suffering from catarrh as attendants, as they give rise to great discomfort.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	For this reason it is not proper to use those who are too old or those who are feverish.</end_of_turn>
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	More suitable are those who are continuously occupied with their duties; and therefore you must command the windpipe to withdraw its hand a little from the sides, fearing the generation of oblivion.</end_of_turn
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	The blowing of aloes is better than the incision of the vein of the groin and the bladder: and therefore you must confirm to sneeze, and to constriction of bile and spleen, and to vomiting, and to filling up.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And you must cover the blowing of aloes with a little oil, for if it is stopped from below, it brings about debility in the body and in the stomach.</end_of_turn
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	The blowing of chamomile brings about headaches and ophthalmia, and diarrhea, and fainting, and pain in the roots of the teeth; and is better than the incision of the mesentery.</end_of_turn
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And you must command the windpipe not to touch its hand with scarification, so as not to puncture the artery and cause blood to flow backwards.</end_of_turn>
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	The blowing from below will make the saliva comfortable, and will correct the corruption of the gums, and will keep them away from the diseases that are in the mouth, and will be better than the incision of the tonsils that are in the armpits.</end_of_turn
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	Better is the blowing that is made over the two spatulas, as it brings about capitation, which is useful for replenishing heat.</end_of_turn
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	The blowing of the armpits towards the flanks of the ribs brings about the support of the incision of three veins, namely the basilica, femoral and cephalic, for those three veins together take away all the greater veins that are in the flesh, and the smaller veins of the other veins which enter under the influence of the attraction of the three veins.</end_of_turn
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	Command the windpipe not to proceed excessively with the scarification, for the flesh is naked, and leaves the nerves and arteries exposed.</end_of_turn
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	This is a blowing that is made over the cushions and brings about the hemorrhoids of the buttocks and the ulcers below.</end_of_turn
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you must command the windpipe to be a great blowing, and that it should be from the palms of the hands, for the flesh cannot digest a strong section; and for that matter there should be coarse and fine blows and be scarred with a scarification.</end_of_turn
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Better are the gentle blows from the palms of the hands than strong blows manifested for a moment, for they take away the blood of the whole body, and bring about relief of ancient pains of the kidneys and bladder; and provoke menstruation, and bring about vomiting and diarrhea; and are better than the incision of two large veins, and of the spleen, and of two hollow cavities.</end_of_turn
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they do not drive out all the blood from the whole body and cause fainting in many people.</end_of_turn>
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the support of vomiting is useful for the support of the blows from two veins.</end_of_turn
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the position of the blows is that it stops the initial vomiting and supports the temperate vomiting, and does not prolong the position of the blows, but rather pauses them leisurely, and resumes them gently, and that the humors come to the place for their movement.</end_of_turn
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease until you see the place already swollen and puffed up and that the color of the blood appears.</end_of_turn
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And when you have finished, scarify and repeat the vomiting little by little, and take into consideration the condition of the body.</end_of_turn
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For the person who has a soft body of a rare complexion, you must make a slight incision and not too much, for the flesh is not to be ulcerated.</end_of_turn
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the windpipe to enlarge the incision a a little extent and to soften it, and to breathe slowly and easily.</end>
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if there is thickness in the blood, you must make two incisions, for in the first incision the passage of the veins to the blood and the water of the blood is opened up.</end_of_turn
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	And in the second incision the acquisition of the extraction of the thick blood is made.</end_of_turn>
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is not thick, you must make a third incision for the third time to achieve the fourth.</end_of_turn
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we wish to extract a great piece of flesh, we must make a great sacrifice; and if we know that the flesh is large, we must make a more abundant sacrifice for it.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of sacrifice is the depth of the wound alone
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the wound is large, hard, fleshy, and its veins are straight, then let the areas of the veins be greased with milder unguents, opened and resolved; if it is in summer, thus as olive oil of aloes or violet oil, or oil of marigolds, or olive oil of poppy seeds; and if it is in winter, then olive oil of marigold, or oil of lily, or oil of chamomile, or of alum, and to those who are similar
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the discharge is large, frothy, then let the oil be bitter almond, or balsam oil, or aloes oil, or pennyroyal oil, and those who are similar
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	May it be if the carrier has wide wounds of tough flesh, then let it be forbidden to give oil, and let the areas of the veins around it be washed with warm water or hot water of the sun, or with vinegar, or with wine, or with broth, and those who are similar
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And if the piece of flesh is of moist humidity, wash the veins with vinegar or with water of myrtle, mastic, and those who are similar
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And if the discharge is thick, wash the veins with strong vinegar or with decoction of rue or of chamomile, or of marigold, and those who are similar
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And let the wound be protected from the bath; having said that, it must be administered together with the bath for an hour or two, and let it rest on the wound.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that should be done so that the wound from the phlebotomy does not appear on the wound?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Consider at the outset: if the phlebotomist or the one who gives the flebotomy is choleric and vents over the patient's flesh acutely and inflammation, then it must be foreseen to cause refrigerating causes, thus as great vinegar, and in vinegar of vinegar and salt, and alum, and chamomile, and those who are similar
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And suspend their meals thus as poultry, and fatty meats, and boiled foods with vinegar, and those who are similar
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And if the composition is cold, let it be foreseen to take almond butter or almond butter of poppy seeds, mastic, and vinegar of mint between broth and water; and that he be recommended to drink little and eat sparingly, and suspend meats of poultry and beef and fish and eggs and small meats and legumes
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And let the drink of the day of phlebotomy and wound be greater than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And let him be given in some hours at breakfast or dinner some medicines of musk, such as musk or alum, before or after the wound or phlebotomy, so that the principal members are comforted and the wound is diminished; and let them not take vinegar or strong drinks
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the wounds that must not be made a sacrifice are those that are upon the chest and foot, and upon the navel, in the joints, and the armpits, because these members must not suffer a sacrifice upon them
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for these except for the attraction of flesh from the member, thus as they stop the wound over the nipple in the disease of the flux of blood from the member; and they use that to dissolve the cold wind that is hidden in the member, thus as over the belly and the navel; for that makes the member limp and scalds it and leaves the pain that resolves the cold wind.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is stopped over the boils when it happens in their boiling or putrefaction, because by the virtue of strong attraction it makes the fluid boil or putrefy and drives out the pus from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And thus it is done when it is stopped over the chest and the foot, it drives out the cold wind in those enclosed places
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These winds are administered cold with vinegar only; and some are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some are administered full of hot water in the diseases of the chest.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is because the wind must be full and large, so it is only hot water or water in which herbs are boiled according to what is convenient
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of wind administered with fire: the breadth of the orifice of two fingers, as we have formed it; and the quantity of fuel is that of a palm; and it is in the lap, in the place where it is in the circuit, the greatest part; the smoke is small according to the quantity that enters it with a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Whether from egg or orange, citron, marjoram, laurel, gentian and angelica, so that it does not damage the limb its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And at the middle of it, a transverse incision of egg or iron, where a candle is held with fire
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this wind is greater than that which we have recommended; and little more of that according to the ailments and the state of the one who uses it
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the winds of the elders are extended to others than the winds of the youths and of great courses
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of applying this wind with fire to the limb is that you extend the flame of fire of wood adequately forward a little candle of wax, and you apply that to the middle of the transverse incision in the middle place of the wind, so that the fire is kindled around the perimeter of the illness so that it is not consumed by the body of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And return it to the limb of the patient, and say that concerning the smoke that we have said, when we have the winds and we do not indicate that they should remain there, and that the vapor escapes from that hole, the wind will be as much dissolved
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And again ignite the flame according to its manner, and repeat that if you do not indicate that you are finishing with that.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	More in the wind that is administered in the disease of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse incision or burn, and which is not administered except that it is filled with water, and is applied only to the limb alone
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the way: And this wind, the greater it is, the better, because it receives a great quantity of water
