Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Blood is not administered in all members but in the limbs in which it is not possible to place the wind, for the smallness of those, thus as with the thumb and little finger and the like; or in a limb denuded of flesh, thus as with the palm of the hand and the like.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those blood vessels that you have found in the deep veins of the foot is that they are in the abundance of mud and earth
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And return the intestines or hernia to their cavity in the morning and in the evening in deep water so that they are softened, and that no remaining cause remains in their belly; and immediately evacuate the body with foam and wind; and cool the limb of the patient until it turns red; and then apply the above-mentioned things
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And thus are they filled and in case<end_turn>
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to drain the area with the wind, it is better for the benefit<end_turn
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, the hours wash the area with wine and add a little water; and scrub and press.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the course of the disease prolongs, add a sponge of lead in cold water, and place that on it until the secretion is discharged<end_turn>
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the disease is multiplied, the hours sprinkle over it powdered vitriol, or urine and resembling their strict causes, until the disease is cured; or that the points are placed on the surface of the limb the greatest quantity of scraped honey, and that they are left until the honey adheres to the limb, and that the disease is cured.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And cover, if necessary, repeated bloodletting, when it is possible to change them<end_turn
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if bloodletting is prohibited, the hours frequently wet the limb with the disease or leave a needle in the places until the disease is cured; and immediately stop them when any sign of healing appears in the limb.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you wish to bathe, sprinkle over those a little of ground aloe or salt or ash, and bathe thoroughly
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus ends the part of the treatise concerning restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very useful necessary in the art of medicine; and is the restoration of fracture and dislocation of bones accidentally<end_turn
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son of these chapters the fools doctors and the vulgar people and those who for a long time do not remember the ancients or do not read their books.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	Therefore, this method of the scientists in our land is a secret; and I have never forgotten it at any time in my life; and I have not divulged it until now, except after having studied the writings of the ancients and understanding them thoroughly.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	I have also directed experiments and studies throughout my life on this matter.</end_of_turn>
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already mentioned in this chapter all that concerns my science and the experiments which I have conducted on this; for I have abridged what I have said to you elsewhere and spared you the details of my research; and I have mentioned in conclusion what I have learned from these observations; and I have set out in this chapter the various forms of treatment which are administered in this case, just as is done in addition to the declaration in the previous chapters.</end_of_turn>
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.</end_of_turn>
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary and collection of the fractures of bones, from which it is necessary to proceed before we begin the reminder of fractured limbs and various other parts of the body.</end_of_turn
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, as we shall say at the beginning of this chapter, we shall speak of the sums of the work; and the chapters which follow are intended to bring to your understanding the artifices and their station on the truth of these matters; for you and those who are learned in this art will know or learn it from us.</end_of_turn
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when an accident of fracture, dislocation, twist or any other similar case occurs, it is necessary at the outset to apply a blistering plaster or bandage, or some other means, if these do not prevent any cause, even if it be a matter of virtue, or if the patient be a young child, or an old man, or if it be a time of great heat or great cold.</end_of_turn
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And thus let us take nourishment only of light herbs, fish, birds and crabs; and let us avoid large meats and fat foods which obstruct the blood of the veins of health, until we are certain that the caut has stopped, and if you do not fear the escape of matter from the limb.</end_of_turn
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And when the patient has recovered, return him to his first place with the attendants who usually attend to him.</end_of_turn
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	Therefore, when the fractured bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the patient be given nourishing food which is neither too thick nor too thin, such as bread soaked in water, broth, eggs, fish, beef, almonds, turnips, and peas, and in this regimen there is a coagulation of the fracture which is more perfect and lasting.</end>
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you must know that bones which are fractured in the elderly or in decrepitude never completely reunite and consolidate according to their nature, because of the drying up of the limb.</end_of_turn
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are consolidated and reunited according to their nature all the time by the drying up of those limbs, and they are reunited and consolidated at the end of their lives, just as the bones of small children.</end_of_turn
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But the nature makes amends and remembers that the fractured bone has been suffered from every side for a long time, so that when it is reunited with its fellow bones, it adheres to them with great strength, until it is finally united with them, just as fire burns at the beginning, until no cause prevents it from doing its work.</end_of_turn
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	Therefore it is necessary to abstain from nourishing the patient with foods which are heavy and viscous and large, as we have said.</end_of_turn
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many different types of fracture according to the nature of the limb.</end_of_turn
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you must know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the nature of the limb, for the fracture of the bone of the thigh is different from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the forearm; and so on with all the other limbs.</end_of_turn
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I remember all the different species of fracture, which are explained in distinct chapters of this book.</end_of_turn
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many different types of fracture exist in general.</end_of_turn
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And there are diverse species of fractures in general; for example, a fracture of the bone in its star-shaped area; and some fractures are called complete fractures, while others are incomplete fractures, just as in the case of writing when one uses a pen, which is a fractured bone with a split in the head, or a slight fracture.</end_of_turn
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for every kind there is an appropriate remedy or treatment which will be remembered in the distinct places of the body.</end_of_turn
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Motion signifies a fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And thus is known a fracture of the bone: it is a twisting of the limb, with the protrusion and displacement of the limb, and so from it when pressure is applied to it with the hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no apparent twisting of the limb or if it is not suspected to be fractured, do not touch the bone unless you see clear agitation and the patient experiences great pain, for then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	There is also the possibility of a slight twisting or small fracture; in which case do not press on it with your hand or compress it; wait a moment and remember the medicines that you know are appropriate in such a case; and do so with stricture of the limb.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the limb is bent and is not broken in two or otherwise that does not cause it to become limp, as is commonly seen throughout its part, then you must begin to rectify it immediately.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it becomes swollen afterwards, leave it for some days until the swelling subsides; and then apply any means that you can think of to levitate and support it
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration of the limb and its nourishment is lighter than that of the bone in which the fracture occurred.<end_turn>
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And take care as you will remember it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	Moreover, if the bone is fractured, it is necessary to extend the limb from two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two strings or with one string and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And keep its position so that the limb remains equal according to its natural figure, while the fractured parts are extended from the limb, so that you can perform its restoration as easily as possible.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	Be careful that you do not cause further pain or injury to the patient during your treatment; and perform it in such a way that the bones support each other as much as possible in a thousand different ways
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And take advantage at that moment of your touch with your hand, and if sometimes there is any other cause, rectify that and support that to the extent of your ability
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid excessive extension and compression, as do many foolish doctors who perform these operations by causing swelling with their cautery or causing spasm in the limb as they have seen in the operations of their foolish colleagues.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And take note, equal calmness, decent performance of the operation and stricture of that limb, rest and tranquility; remind the patient about this and make him believe that he should not suffer in the hours of his watchfulness and sleep, and see his recovery and agitation, and do his elimination, and do all his movements with all his ability; and wait until you can change the position of the limb to one that ensures him no longer feels pain; for the cause of this is that when it is placed in the position of the painful limb or injury, it causes him pain; so change it to another position that does not cause him pain; and keep it steady and equal so that the limb does not suffer twisting when it is restored
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the stricture of the limb is that which I recommend; for you know that fractured limbs are diverse in their size and shape
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as the arm, the finger and the toe, the covering should be of soft material.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But for those that are large, such as the thigh or the forearm, cover them with firm and hard material, which will connect the great limb firmly and strengthen it throughout its entirety without damaging it
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And so, begin, make your evacuation of equipment convenient, and tie the ligament properly in that place where the fracture is to be made with three coverings or four as the limb deserves; and strengthen your hand a little on the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And look at that part furthest from the fracture site, and strengthen less than that where you have strengthened the fractured part.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And gradually lengthen the covering of the fracture site a a moderate degree, and soften the stricture little by little, until you can grasp the limb well again.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And take another bandage and cover that other covering over the fractured limb with the covering, and look at the coverings at the furthest part of the fracture; and do your operation on the tightening of the covering and the softening of that as we said in the first covering
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	If there is a twist in the fracture, and it is twisted, then pause between the edges of the swelling, if there is swelling; otherwise, do not pause for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	If there is no swelling or pus, leave the dressing in place for a few days; and if there is pus or swelling, support the area firmly.</end_of_turn>
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	The edges of the wound must be firmly supported and the dressing must be formed skillfully; or it may be of felt or palm leaves; and let the width of each dressing be as follows:...</end_of_turn>
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	But the dressing that is placed on that fracture must be larger and wider than the others, and the length of the dressing must be according to the size of the limb in magnitude and in width; and support the dressing firmly on the other side according to your first rule; and hold in place firmly as we have said above, and that the dressing should be as much as the fracture itself, and as little as the fracture is prolonged.</end_of_turn>
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be finer in thickness and in flexibility, and be of thread; and if the threads are coarse, thus I have seen for the operation of many fractures when the threads are cut during the tightening of the dressing, and this is a great error, when the dressing is taken out equal to the fracture.</end_of_turn
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	Subtle threads are not convenient, because you will not achieve a tightening of the dressing as you wish; and do not let there be less than a finger's breadth between the dressings.</end_of_turn>
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient's pain is in the extremities of the limbs, pause the tightening in those places until it does not cause him damage.</end_of_turn
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some fractures are like wounds, and accidents of disruption in the bone, and I recall in the capitol according to singularity.</end_of_turn
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And remember that every fractured limb is not straight at first; the cause of this is that when the limb is great, it does not suffice to support it on the dressing for a few days or a few weeks, according to your security of the advancement of pus.</end_of_turn
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the way that the ancients restored the plasters, which were placed on fractures, dislocations and twists.</end_of_turn>
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of plastering as seen in the restoration of fractures, convenient for many complex cases and especially for women and men, because of which it is that about which neither heat nor cold is harmful: and take powdered charcoal, which is the medula of the wheat that is left over from the dough in the manufacture of bread.</end_of_turn
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And do the same if there is an album of blood, and pause the application of the dressing until it is not thick or sticky; and use that.</end_of_turn
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way of dressing a fracture, dislocation or twist: recipe of asafoetida, of lapdanum, of acacia, of enula, and marigold, which is ground from a thousand grains of fennel, five grains of myrrh and five grains of aloes; twenty grains of aloe. All of these are powdered and sifted and mixed with water, or with egg white if the patient's wound is raw; and use this dressing, for it is of good composition and strengthens the broken bones pleasantly, and gives comfort to the patient.</end_of_turn>
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way of dressing a fracture which gives comfort: recipe marigold and white alum to two drachmas; of myrrh and aloes five to each drachm; of acacia six to each drachm; of linseed twenty to each drachm.</end_of_turn
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	...all are crushed in a mortar with a rough stone, and are ground, and are mixed with water or with blood and is administered.</end>
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Manipulation of joints and bones separated from their locations, and that causes pain in those, fractures and breaks: take lancets and immerse them in vinegar and oil, and place them on the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	In this treatment there is no benefit of restoration, of ointment, but rather expulsion of the pain directly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of treatment that restores broken bones: take figs and poppy seeds; mix them up and make a plaster of them
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A shortened method of treatment that is administered after fracture of bones and when you wish to resolve the residue of ointment: mix meadowsweet, chamomile and violets flowers, barley flour, and all of this together. All of this is crushed and mixed with vinegar, if the limb is not scorched.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is scorched, however, the best is to soften it with water of gentian or with water and use it as a compress
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of dressing is stronger in resolving this than the previous one, when the accident is of thick ointment must be restored to the limb: mix meadowsweet and linseed seeds, barley, balm, marjoram, violets, chamomile, all of this together and saffron; crush all of this and mix it with vinegar or other liquid or wine, according to the quality of the limb and the degree of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	Hippocrates does not say that it is proper to leave an open wound free that must be placed on the limb after its restoration, except for certain occasions where it is necessary to do so with wax and oil; and I recommend that it be more moderate between thickness and thinness
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	Indeed in Gaul it is seen that it is placed on the fractured limb after its restoration and the causes in which it is necessary to leave it exposed with little heat so as to do in the case of myrrh, incense and similar things to these causes that we have recommended
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A method of dressing that relieves the lesion and pain: mix wheat, barley, poppy seeds, ground ivy or fennel seeds, meadowsweet, salt, and saffron; crush all of this together and sift it, and make a plaster of it.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The quantity should be such that it covers the ligature and if it is too little it is not sufficient to stop the pain or the swelling or if the bone is fractured it is not worth having it. In such a case do not remove the dressing for several days
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if the limb has sudden pain or swelling or inflammation, then take it away or remove it in that moment and leave the plaster on it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take sponge of linen and marine sponge soaked in warm water, and immerse that in lukewarm water; with which wash the limb until the swelling and pain cease; then remove the dressing from the limb for an hour; then place over it lancets soaked in vinegar and oil or olive oil, and bind over it for a night until you are certain that the ointment has healed, and that the swelling of the limb has subsided, and that the pain has gone away.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And do this in such a way as to make the dressing smaller and less strict, and do not bind it too tightly for your first constriction, but rather do it gradually as it improves.</start_of_turn>
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if sometimes the ointment has healed and the swelling and pain and inflammation have gone away and all the accidents have already disappeared, and digestion of the dressing and stricture has begun, then repeat this in the same way as you did at the beginning when you began to make the plaster.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no other accident occurs to the limb of those we have mentioned, do not remove the dressing until three or four or five or seven days have passed Some authors leave it for xx days as we have said, according to the appearance of the limb for the loosening of the bone, until the fracture has healed, and until the blood clot has coagulated over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And adjust the bandage more gently than at the beginning of the treatment, and in the digestion of the patient's food, as it is preceded by the memory of it.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If sometimes the limb of the fracture has dried out and become loose more than it covers, then you must know that nutrition is prohibited for it; therefore give it lukewarm water instead of food for three days; and relieve the dressing a little; for this operation will restore the limb to nutrition and will heal it well
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	More than the fools of the healers of the fracture of the limb, another treatment for the restoration of the limb is more harmful than helpful when not restored from the beginning, according to the covering of the wound; for it is harmful by the operation of its makers, and fear is great, and if they did not know how to do it, it would increase the pangs in the limb when it is free and make it worse in the water of treatment.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have never seen anyone do that, for it is more reasonable that it does not happen.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter two: Of fracture when it occurs in the head.</end_of_turn>
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are blows, and the figures of them are various, and the causes are different, for every fracture is caused by percussion of space, and the percussion hinders all the bone within the cavity, which is left to the bone, just as it happens in the wrist; and because of this this species is called traumatic; or the space strikes any part of the bone, and strikes the marrow of it and does not pass the incision through to the back of it; and this species of fracture is called complete fracture.</end_of_turn>
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures is great or little, and of a fracture that is contracted or retracted; and the cause of them is percussion with a blunt or sharp object, and they resemble each other.</end_of_turn
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating that has already approached the canal which is left to the bone; or it is in the face of the bone, and the plague of these two fractures is great or little.</end_of_turn
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And the fracture is that which is hidden in the bone, in the substance of the small vein, and because of this it is called capillary fracture.</end_of_turn
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And the fracture is that which is caused by blow or by chance or by percussion of stone and that causes any layer of the bone to enter the parts surrounding it, and it is fatal in the hollow part just as when it happens to the nails when they are struck by percussion and some of them enter the surrounding parts.</end_of_turn
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And it is mostly fatal when it happens to the bones of humid substances, just as with their heads.</end_of_turn
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these traumatic fractures are like pieces of glass that are separated from each other.</end_of_turn
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I come to mourn for all that is in this place.</end_of_turn>
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I know all these species of fractures by recognition for their detection on them and for their inquiry in their attempts and for the presence of corrupted marrow that is over them.</end_of_turn
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	The capillary fracture is known for appearing on the bone, and is excised, and is limited on it with a pin, which makes the fracture appear black.</end_of_turn
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fracture attention should be paid at the beginning to the signs of the disease, and when sometimes for the signs that indicate seriousness such as vomiting of bile, extension, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, syncope, high fever, and suddenness of these symptoms, as well as the presence of these symptoms in their most severe forms, even if they are not healing.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if sometimes non-violent accidents happen to you, you hope for health, the hour you begin the treatment of them.</end_of_turn
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause of which is that if it is provoked at the beginning like that which is provoked in the days of spring, the hour you study in the bone marrow until the thirteenth day according to all custom.</end_of_turn
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the summer days, the hour you must keep the bone marrow until the seventh day, having left the bone marrow corrupted from the canal, and that these accidents happen which we have recommended.</end_of_turn
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the canal covering the brain, and is contracted in small parts and retracted, the hour you must insert the diminished part and retract it, as I recommend to you.</end_of_turn
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you take the head of the disease that is plagued, and uncover the bone according to custom and handle it as you are able according to the figure of the plague, and that you inquire about the disease.</end_of_turn
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if an accident happens to you, you must oppose the detection of the bone, flux of blood or caut dressing, the hour you are opposed to it as much as possible, and that you cover the area with cloths soaked in wine and oil, and make the plague rest until the swelling subsides; and be sure to flux blood of the vein; and begin to move the limb around the bone and in the cavity.</end_of_turn
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to two methods of operation.</end_of_turn

E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer even more of the wider incision.</end_of_turn
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	The sovereign shall declare his name to the scribes, for some of them are more learned than others; and some of them are more brief than others and are at the rear of the order of their limbs, and they are of iron or venomous.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use of them allows for easy percussion on the scribes so that they do not bruise the head and cause them to bleed.

E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus except when those that do not stop the limit of the bone towards that which is adjacent to them, for when the puncture is round about the limb or margin over that which is left, the head of the limb appears like a margin or a small circle, which prohibits it from being immersed and passing the spiciness of the bone.

And this is the form of three species of punctures: The quality of puncturing around the fractured bone is that you pause the puncture on the bone and rotate that around the toes until you know that the bone is already pierced; and then change the puncture to another location and stop when there is between every fracture the quantity of the thickness of the ray or around it.

And so it is appropriate to touch the scribes between every fracture of the bone, and make them more subtle than you would over that in order to lift it, as we have said, until you have extracted the bone, or with your hand, or by any other cause that may cause them to be stirred, as for example nails and fine forceps
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And know that you must take great care that the scribe does not touch any cause of swelling.

And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the pulp, and that which is broken off or remains of the bone is the face of it, and remains in it roughness and cartilages subtle, then know that you must grasp that roughness and extract those cartilages with subtle reasons for which you have prepared a number, of various quantities so that you can manage them in all locations in the most convenient way and the most subtle of them according to what you lose in your operation that broken bone and the figure of it.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And know that you must administer at your ratio with which reasons the bone at the beginning of the most lateral of those reasons, and indeed use that which is of the most subtle of them, and do not cease until you have finished administering the most tense and the most subtle of all of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	Indeed in any other small fractures capillary and slight fracture subtle, know that you must take care according to what you lose for the rectification of it
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	For it is not hidden that all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And thus we stand upon what has been shown to us in great fractures.

And take care that the plague in your care does not become worse; and do not put anything greasy on it; neither leave it uncovered; for when it is adjusted upon the bone of the brain, it corrupts that and brings about death, and brings about that which is malicious.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte. E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if no accident occurs except for the medicine that is being discontinued, and it is in virtue of that medicine that makes that blackness, then take a little more of that medicine and a little more of rosemary oil three parts. and put on that some bandage, and place that over the wound; and care for that with the spices of treatment that you consider until it is healed.</start_of_turn>

De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is fractured.</start_of_turn
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not fractured but rather two pieces are separated with abundant pus so that in it there are two bones, for the part left is cartilaginous and is not fractured and does not cause it any harm but rather itching and torment and swelling.</start_of_turn
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	May it even be fractured one of the two parts of the nose, then you must insert little by little in the ditch of the nose that engulfs that fracture as much as the index finger and as much as the thumb, until the nose returns to its natural figure.</start_of_turn
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And it is done for you to facilitate this, and take care that you do not cause him any pain during that treatment of the patient.</start_of_turn
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the soft part of the nose, and you say that it is not for this, then you must make it equal to the extremity of the ray where the smallness is.</start_of_turn
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then do the same for that.</start_of_turn
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And keep the restoration of it on the first day of the fracture if possible; and if not, then leave it for six days or eight days so that you can give it time to heal.</start_of_turn
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And insert in the extremity of the nose a bandage of linen, if the fracture is in one part, or two collars, if the fracture is in two parts, and the collar has the thickness of such quantity that it fills the ditch of the nose.</start_of_turn
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And say to the former restorers that the collars should be bound on the edge, and should be changed throughout the day, even though I do not see it; because you must know that the bandage should be bound with moist hemp soaked in vinegar with powdered oatmeal.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And some people put sponges inside the nose instead of a collar, because of the increase of pus which is enveloped in linen; and that you know that the fracture of the nose is very severe and that the patient is not prohibited from inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This is not necessary for you; and if you want, do this, and if you want, do that.</start_of_turn>
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another sponge comes out during treatment, cover the nose with cerate or coat it with fat infused with wine and rosemary oil, or with diaperium.</start_of_turn
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	And if it does not come out during treatment, cover it with barley flour and powdered gentian with moist hemp soaked in vinegar; and place over that a lion, and do not lie the nose down for any reason.</start_of_turn
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	If even the bones of the nose are fractured in a small or large degree, it is necessary to make an incision above them, extract them with the instruments that are appropriate for them; and then close the incision, and care for that which encloses and consolidates, and apply appropriate plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is swelling in the nose, it is necessary to cure that by compressing it and administering lead canulas until it is completely healed.</end_of_turn>

De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is fractured.</end_of_turn
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is fractured and the fracture is not associated with swelling, it is necessary to assess if the fracture is displaced only, and not fractured in two parts and bent outwards. In this case, the pain is slight.</end_of_turn
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	Therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, insert the index finger of the left hand into the patient's mouth; and in the same way, if the fracture is on the left side, insert the index finger of the right hand; and push with both hands at the base of the fracture outwards, facilitating the displacement of the fragments.</end_of_turn
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw has already separated into two parts, it is necessary to administer extension of the two parts according to the rectitude until it is possible to equalize them.</end_of_turn
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is displacement of teeth with fracture, extract those that you expect to remain whole with gold, silver or ivory; and then stop bleeding on the fractured jaw, and place a swab over the fracture twice, and over the large pulp correspondingly; and ligate that which is appropriate for the fracture, as it is bound.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	Command the patient to rest and tranquility, and abstain from eating for a lion's share of days.</end_of_turn>
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you see that the figure has already been altered in any way, cover it up and remove it on the third day; and then correct what has already been altered of it and plaster that which is left with powder of wheat, albumin of eggs, or oatmeal, because you do not want to leave anything else of it uncovered, and cover with a linen bandage.</end_of_turn
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And when it is fixed and adjusted that plaster on it, and the position of the bone is not altered, leave it as it is, do not remove it until it is healed and the fracture is strong; for if the swelling of this fracture is not reduced in three periods.</end_of_turn
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another swelling occurs afterwards, administer what has been said of the swelling in the peace of it until it is healed, and remove that swelling.</end_of_turn
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is associated with swelling, consider if it is a simple fracture of the bone or a dislocation, for in this case you are recommended to leave those dislocations until they are resolved with those which cause them.</end_of_turn
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the wound is narrow, expand it with the flebotomy according to the quantity of your need.</end_of_turn
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have finished removing those dislocations, and of those which you do not remove, close the wound if it is wide; otherwise, place over that one of the plasters that is appropriate and consolidate that which is left, until it is healed.</end_of_turn

De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the collarbone when it is fractured.</end_of_turn
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	The fracture of the collarbone is usually caused by damage to the muscles on the front of the bone.</end_of_turn
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	For it is fractured, or separated, or separated into two parts which do not cause dislocations; and it is necessary to restore it; or if dislocations occur with it, it is difficult to restore it; or if the fracture is associated with swelling.</end_of_turn
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in this case, when the fracture is associated with swelling, is that two assistants are present, one to support the fractured collarbone and the other to extend the shoulder on that side.</end_of_turn
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And apply pressure to the fracture with the thumbs until the shape of it is restored according to what is appropriate, without leaving it excessively tense or flattened.</end_of_turn
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you see more extension, cover the thumb of the patient with a pad or cloth, and make the size of it according to the quantity of your need; and extend and elevate the collarbone and cover the swelling with your hand until the fracture is resolved according to what is appropriate.</end_of_turn
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If the thumb cannot be drawn out from the socket, so that it reaches the wrist, then cover that the patient should be supine on their neck, and place a cushion under their muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	The attendants according to the muscle of the thumb to the outside must elevate the bone of the thumb so that it reaches the wrist, and then you can rectify the fracture and bind what is between the thighs together
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	Even if you feel pain in the thumb and swelling, cover that you should lie over that area and extract those swellings easily
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, cover that you make an incision of the thumb with one of the instruments which you have prepared, because you have already stopped the thumb from the pain that serves the wrist; and that pain is of the bone or of iron of which this is the form
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	It is similar to a wound of which this is the cavity; and its width according to what you need of it, according to the size of the bone or the thinness of it
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	The length of the incision should be as much as possible for the operation; that there be two extremities thus as many times, and that one extremity be broad and the other narrow
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the membrane which you have incised when you have extracted the swelling from the bone is wide, and you are sure of aftercare, cover that you adjust the two lips of the membrane together with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is slight, or you fear aftercare, cover that you cover the membrane with gauze and powder according to the quantity of the wound of the membrane
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if aftercare is delayed, cover that you soak in warm oil and vinegar and oil, and rest over that area
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the bone is rigid when the wound is closed and the section is finished, that you place a plaster of broken wheat with an egg white on the wound and put a lion over it, and put a little powder around the edges of the wound, if you are not satisfied with that, and take a little moisture, as the Sarrazins say, that is neither too long nor too short, and the width of it from thumb to thumb or about as much; and put double powder around the wound and the plaster; and take a nail of moderate size, which is about three fingers wide and as long as the wound itself; and wrap this around the wound, and wrap the wound around the nail over the fracture; and take a little moisture as before, and turn the wound over the head of the thumb and over the thumb of the patient, and reduce the wound over the whole part, and when the fracture is rigid with the surrounding tissues, that is what is not hidden under your hand.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	All this, however, that the nail should not be seen over the broken bone; and so that you see the patient every day, because when the ligament is softened or the nail itself is already softened, cover that you rectify this and strengthen the bandage
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And finally, keep the patient's foot elevated over the head, and leave the thumb resting on the foot for the night a little cushion; so that the adjutors of the thumb are elevated at the elevation of the muscle; or that the arm of the thumb is bound to the head of the thumb.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	Do not remove the bandage if no accident has occurred in the place or aftercare, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And renew the plaster if you have seen the face of the wound to that, and adjust in the rigidity and restore that and leave until it is restored and the fracture of the thumb is coagulated
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And is strong and comfortable according to the month in xxviii days, and some herbs in several homes is useful in a month of that time.
