De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Treatment of Thumb Fractures
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The thumb bone is broken in the middle part of the joint and not at the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is broken in the middle of the joint – and it is broken in the middle of the thumb – and it is not known except by touch, cover that according to the figure of the fracture force you to prepare it and reduce that according to the natural figure in every way that is possible for you to do
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And put over the wound a plaster of broken wheat with an egg white and put a lion over it; and put a little powder around the wound; and put a little moisture around the nail of moderate size
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	If the nail is left with a cavity in some parts of the wound, cover that you cover that cavity with a lion, and put the nail equal again
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then draw down your hand with a long stroke from the constriction downwards towards the heel, without stretching the skin too tightly.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider the ligament in each part; and whenever it is seen to be softened, bind another one and stretch it equally so that it is neither too tight nor too loose
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And hold the patient's thigh towards the side with your hand.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spatula is restored in about xx days or in xxv
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And when this number is completed, then you dissolve the ligament and know for certain that that which is from the bones from which you began is neither feared nor dissolved.</start_of_turn>
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the foot bone and leave the tendon behind, then you will split over it and leave it, and do as has been said in the fracture of the sadistic prominence of the scapula bone.</start_of_turn>
Capitol .vii.	End of Document.</start_of_turn>
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of the fracture of the foot bone.</start_of_turn
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The bones of the foot are fractured in the middle of their length, and this is where they must be broken; but their extremities must not be broken because they must remain whole and flexible.</start_of_turn
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And as for the accidents of the foot when its middle is fractured, they are that it is inclined downwards towards the plantar part and causes great pain, difficulty in walking, coughing, vomiting and fainting; and is declared in the cavity of the fractured bone and is not concealed from the feeling.</start_of_turn
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that you rest the patient on the two thighs, and place between the buttocks of the patient a cushion; and then press on the muscles of the foot, and adjust the ribs to the greatest extent of two ribs, and support them in the operation of it and in the equalization according to all the rules that are possible and convenient, until you restore the shape of the bone as it was before.</start_of_turn
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then pause over the plaster and bandage and pause over the dressing of soft gauze or cloth and their remnants in suspension; because you encase them in wax. And then support that which is above the fractured bone so that it is not bruised; and keep it bound according to the rounding of each ligament, and stretch that which is of stricture downwards; and consider the ligament at all times, and when it is softened stretch that one.</start_of_turn
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary you cause a loosening of that, you must correct the inflammation or swelling, pain or prominence that occurs in the place, then you will cover it and remove that and rectify what has happened in such a way as to care for it; and then reduce the plaster, sometimes up to the face; and adjust the stricture so that it is healthy.</start_of_turn
Capitol .viii.	End of Document.</start_of_turn
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the back when it is fractured.</start_of_turn
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that the fracture of the ribs does not take place except in the hollow parts that follow the two; and as for the extremities of them from the front part, it does not cause them to curve inwards but only because of the cartilage.</start_of_turn
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And you must recognize that it is not hidden from the feeling that you must inquire about it according to what is said.</start_of_turn
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is just as to embrace the fracture according to what is said, except that it must be embraced according to that which covers it, and then support the fractured bone with a splint, if you do not wish for that.</start_of_turn
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs is inclined downwards towards the plantar part, then it causes the patient great pain and puncture, just as if it were a puncture of that which has pleura, and because the bone puts on the membrane; and it causes difficulty in swallowing, coughing, vomiting and fainting; and this is of difficult care.</start_of_turn
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the Ancients have devised in that way that it should not impede.</start_of_turn
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And so they say: cover that you suspend food from the patient that generates inflammation and wind, so that the belly is not swollen and is extended, and the fracture is impeded from the parts outwards.</start_of_turn
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	May we avoid this so that it is not the cause of causing further pain; and if it has already happened, then you can help with that.</start_of_turn
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And I say to you that the wind should be stopped and that you should take with forcitude; and it is like reasoning, but indeed it is feared that the wind will draw out the humors from the place because of the weakness.</start_of_turn
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And he said to them: cover the wound with a bandage that is already submerged in oil, and let fine particles of alum between the ribs until it is full, that is, let the dressing adhere when it covers the wound again; and then let the pain be treated with the care of food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if it causes violent constriction of the pain that does not suffer, and you pierce it with a pointed needle, remember about the pain, for when you cover the wound, uncover the area around the fracture, and then stop that instrument which conserves the bowels, remembering that which precedes it, and that it facilitates the bones, and extract it.</end_of_turn>
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And if it is great, we should suture the two lips of the wound, and cure that with plasters until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if it happens that there is swelling after the bath, then let your hand rest in olive oil and place it over the wound, and let the pain be treated with what covers the swelling after the bath.</end_of_turn>
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And rest on the side on which you sleep, until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.</end_of_turn>
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the spine of the thigh and the heel.</end_of_turn>
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	In some cases the fracture occurs in the bones of the heel, and sometimes at the thigh bones. The spine bones are affected in the same way.</end_of_turn
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when such things happen to some, and you wish to know if he is healed or not, consider that sometimes the wounds are more softened, but sometimes they are swollen and dead, and you cannot bend them or extend them or stretch them, and when you compress them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and you do not feel pain in them, then you know that he is not healed, and in these matters of disposition it is deadly.</end_of_turn
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you see that and feel that constriction with your fingers and needle, then you know that the marrow of the bone is saved and that the pain will go away with care.</end_of_turn
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the spine bones of the heel like that and you wish to know if he is healed or not, then consider the weight of his foot.</end_of_turn
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then sometimes when they are softened, the accident has occurred in the most important, and when you put your hand on the two thighs, you feel heat and swelling, and some people fall asleep on the two thighs and are unable to urinate, then you know that it is deadly, and do not work on his care.</end_of_turn
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	May it be that no other cause of these has occurred, the cause is better and lighter.</end_of_turn
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the care of them is that you perforate the wound with a cautery needle that rests over the fractured spine, with olive oil or with cold compresses of vinegar; place your hand over that until the wound is closed.</end_of_turn
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And let us pause one of the comfortable plasters and put on that which binds; and command the patient to rest and be tranquil and not to sleep on the part where he feels pain until he is healed.</end_of_turn
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if the fracture has occurred from a fall or any other cause that has separated from it, then let us cover that with a bandage and keep that bone in place; and then suture the two lips of the wound, if it is great, and cure that with the care of the wound, until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if it is fractured at the back of the thigh bone, and it is the end of the limb, then let us put our left hand over the buttock and grasp the fractured bone with the right hand as well as is possible; and then let us put on the bandage and plaster, if necessary, and keep that still.</end_of_turn
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if the heel bones are fractured in them, then let us rest over that, and keep that, and cure the wound with the care that precedes it until it is healed.</end_of_turn
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.</end_of_turn
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the restoration of the limb.</end_of_turn
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the limb are often fractured, and if they are fractured, then the fracture is only a communication in the extremities of those and is inscribed in the length and declines towards the inward parts; and it happens that the patient feels pain in the area and punctures, and the limb is stupefied when it is fractured.</end_of_turn
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of them is that you extend your hand over that which is over the fracture in the shape of it.</end>
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	If the fracture is only in the extremity, then you must embrace that part as it is normally worn until it is put back into its natural position.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	Even if the fracture is in the leg or is already drooping downwards, then you must make the patient lie on the abdomen until such time as you are ready to restore the fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And therefore when you have embraced that part, stop over the dressing, and then stop over the bandage of lint or wool, and strengthen it with a tight bandage over which you do not fear making points of fracture or removing the splinter
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	Embrace the concavity with that which is within that which supports the restriction according to equality, and command the patient to lie on their side or recline on their side as well
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	If blood vessels should happen to burst after the cautery, then you must stop the extension of the limb and the restoration of the limb until the blood vessel has clotted, and stop over it until that which is precedent has passed; and then return to the restoration of the limb, and strengthen it thus as before.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if it should happen in the heel bones or they are fractured, then you must treat them

De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the adjunct.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjunct is that which is between the hip bone and the head of the femur
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is fractured, the restoration of the limb is in two ways, of which one is that you take a piece of bone of moderate size following this fashion:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And suspend it from the elevated place with two ligaments
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And keep the patient lying on a seat; and then pull the fractured limb out from over the bone until it reaches the middle part of the limb from which the curvature of the limb is appended
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And if there is any other serious cause, or if the limb is too stiff, extend the limb downwards; and the physician must place something that supports the fracture more firmly, until the fracture returns as it should
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient be placed lying down on the neck and suspend the hand of the limb from the collarbone by a ligament; and command two assistants to hold one that supports the fracture on its sides; and the other to hold the limb; and each of them extend to their part.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you wish that the extension should be stronger, then strengthen over the fracture by a ligament and over that by another ligament, and each of the assistants extend their two parts.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	Therefore if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, cover that half of the ligament over the trochanter and the other over the fracture against the hipbone.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	Similarly if the fracture is near the hipbone, cover that ligament over that place and over the hipbone
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Embrace that which is easy and useful, and when it is sufficiently embraced as it should be, then strengthen that which is not blood clotted after the cautery
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	Even if blood vessels should burst after the cautery, then lay aside the restriction until the seventh day, and stop over it a bandage of wool and oil of rosemary until the blood vessel has clotted, and then strengthen that again
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the way to strengthen that is to place the plaster over the fracture, and then place a layer of lint around the plaster; and adjust the arm over that adjunct, and place your hand open over the muscle
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And suspend the limb and strengthen over the adjunct the arm so that the arm is in place, if nothing else prevents it from any cause of the fractured bone
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And use crutches.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And place over the fracture that staple which is stronger and sturdier than the others; and place between each staple the width of a finger, and the length of the staples according to the fracture in addition to three fingers from the whole part
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And strengthen over the staples on the restriction which I mentioned at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And that your restriction over the location of the fracture be more straight
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture is longer, the restriction is smaller
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	Therefore if sometimes the position of the staples and the restriction is as we have said at the hour when we restored the limb to its natural position, then you must do it.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	If you fear an embolism, then leave the stricture and the stones inside for seven days as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	If you consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that it does not become inflamed or swollen; or if food is prohibited in order to reach the limb by the action of the stricture; then rectify all this as we have said.</end_of_turn>

De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Restoration of a Fractured Arm.</start_of_turn
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm consists of two bones which are called the ulna and the radius; of which the one is small, which is called the olecranon, and the other is large, which is that which is supported from behind the little finger, from the part beyond the wrist.</start_of_turn
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And it is strong that only the large bone is fractured, or only the small, or both are fractured together.</start_of_turn
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the small bone is fractured, the restoration of it is easy, and its healing is easier.</start_of_turn
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the large bone is fractured behind the wrist, the fracture is bad, and the healing is difficult.</start_of_turn
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And the worse of all is when both bones are fractured together.</start_of_turn
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore if the bone that is fractured is the small one outside, it is convenient for the doctor to restore it, which should be done with little extension until it is healed.</start_of_turn
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	And if the large bone is fractured, the hour cover that you pause extension even more violently.</start_of_turn
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both bones are fractured together, the hour cover that you must keep the limb still as much as possible.</start_of_turn
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And you must keep the figure of the hand still during the restoration of it and the extension of it supported on a cushion, and that the thumb be lower than the other fingers, and the wrist be lower than the other fingers, and the patient be sitting on a cushion.</start_of_turn
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And let there be a cushion under the arm or on the side of the arm, so that the patient does not move.</start_of_turn
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And let the attendants extend the arm from the part beyond the wrist towards the shoulder or towards the ligament, and another attendant extend them in the same way.</start_of_turn
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And the doctor should heal the bone until it is reduced according to the better figure that can be made.</start_of_turn
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if there is swelling of the bone, the hour perforates to reduce the whole limb in the socket with your art.</start_of_turn
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus. And if an embolism occurs at the beginning of your restoration, the hour lays a bandage with a little rosemary and white wax, and let it be half between stiffness and softness, and strengthen the bandage over that which is over the stricture until the embolism is gone; and the hour leaves the bandage and pauses the plaster prepared from powdered gypsum with lime, and put on the stones; and let the stone which is placed over that fracture be more firm and strong.</start_of_turn
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	The bones of the arm bear witness in the greater abundance, or a fracture in one or two bones together.

De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	De restauration de fractura del os de la coyssa.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The thigh bone being moved about is fractured and is declared to be converted to the surrounding parts and the sovereign pus.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And the restoration is done in this way that the ligament is stretched over the fracture and another ligament leaves the fracture, and the patient lies prone on the belly and on the face
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	Then the minister extends all the ligament to its quality according to the quality, when the fracture is in the middle of the bone
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	May be at the root of the thigh, but the ligament is properly placed to the nail at the fifth part, so that the extension is made there, and the other ligament leaves the fracture
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	Similarly, if the fracture is at the nail, then properly place the ligament to the nail and make the extension to the parts beyond
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And the doctor should bite the bone on both sides as much as he can until he reduces that which is according to the natural shape; and the bone is united by good junction; the hour is that he stops applying pressure and performs stricture, if it does not happen to the limb afterwards
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	And if it happens afterwards, the hour is that you leave it for a few days until the swelling subsides, and then you return to your care.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The stricture is like this: cover the fracture with a hard bandage, and bend it two or three times, and remove the excess; and then cover the wound until it reaches the hip and the root of the thigh.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And insert a long thread firmly between the thigh and the wound near the nail at the parts beyond, and bring the extremities of the thread from the part furthest from the sovereign pus to the two parts, and then roll over the wound and the thigh as much as the bandage allows
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And stop on the thigh in the place of that fracture, and stop with two staples on the bone of the wound
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And fill the space between the wound and the thigh with soft cloth, so that the stricture is coagulated
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And begin to tighten the stricture firmly from the middle over the place of the fracture with three layers or four, and when you have advanced as much as you can along the ligament at the place of the fracture, your stricture is less and lighter and softer
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And extend two ends of the thread to the parts beyond until it reaches the ankle, and strengthen both ends of the staples of the other part so that the ligament is not strained from the joint
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And keep the stricture on for as long as this, so that no accident happens to the limb crooked or swelling or pus; and if any of these things happen, then immediately take it away and rectify what happened as soon as possible, as we have said above.</start_of_turn>
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	And if in the bone is bad of the bone which you put, then cover that as much as you can; and if not, go away from it and leave that, and care for what precedes the memory until it is healed.</start_of_turn>
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And many other things are strengthened in this fracture of the thigh as well as the nails, as we have said in the treatise and in the books.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps. De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	Restoration of the fracture of the thigh bone.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	You know that the fracture of the thigh bone is often accompanied by swelling, but it does not happen always with the movement of the limb

Capitol .xvi.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.</start_of_turn>

De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the care of nodules that happen in the aftermath of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural. De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Restoration of a fracture when the limb is restored and at this point the limb should be kept flexible according to its natural movement.</end_of_turn>

When a bone fracture has healed, and at this point the limb is flexible, the following causes may prevent proper healing: too much tension on the ligament and its surrounding tissue due to inadequate support; excessive stiffness of the ligaments, preventing proper nutrition to the limb; excessive swelling; abnormal movement at an inappropriate time; insufficient support in the patient's condition, or weakness in the limb.</end_of_turn

Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the abnormal displacement of any joint in the limb, causing it to become immobile, and is accompanied by pain and great damage to the surrounding tissues.</end_of_turn
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, it is necessary to seek medical attention as soon as possible to reduce the dislocation without delay, as if it is delayed, the limb is deformed and the dislocation becomes more difficult to reduce.</end_of_turn
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And let me remind you not to move or stretch at the time of elimination, because the moisture seen during that time can cause spasms and pain in the lower parts.
