And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the hand be extended with two hands, the arms be expanded, and the hands of the doctor be over the knee and hold it, and the plaster the joint with the nails of the thumbs, or at the root of the palm so that it returns to its place.</start_of_turn
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	And even if the dislocation is at the front, the hour returns just as much as it bends the hand with the hand, until it breaks the knee at the root of the palm.</start_of_turn
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, the hour gives violent extension and much force.</start_of_turn
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And two assistants extend the arms, and hold that eye with two assistants so that it is not left behind during the extension.</start_of_turn
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And thus rotate the arms throughout the part, because it is enveloped with soft matter folded long over the hand, or ligament.</start_of_turn
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he should apply some oil to it so that these causes which help to lubricate the joint are facilitated; and then he should gently press the joint inwards until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And he should reduce the swelling that has occurred on the limb by applying a compress which is adhesive and exudes moisture from a paste of alum, and which should be removed with a tight dressing, and the arm should be suspended from the collarbone and left in place for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And so if the joint is formed in the heel, then you should dissect the ligament of the ankle and leave it loose.</start_turn>
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if the joint is not too painful, then you should cover it with a plaster and leave the ligament in place, leaving it in for several days until it is removed; and then dissect it.</start_turn>
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	However, if the limb is affected by gravity during the reduction of the joint, and its condition is in motion, then administer moisture in broth and olive oil, and compress, until the swelling has subsided; or rest on the joint without movement, since it is an oily swelling; and then bind it, and leave it in place for the day and night.</start_turn
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And so on, put on the bath; and when the swelling subsides, then gently massage the joint with tempered friction, and then repeat the process once more, so that there is a total of three treatments.</start_turn
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already spread throughout the bowels, within which it is limited.</end_of_turn
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, rest on the wound of the moist and scaly ulcer at the border and stretch over that; and perform several compresses, so that it becomes moist and reduces its swelling.</start_turn
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.</start_turn
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the care of dislocation of the limb, that is, the joint between the arm and the hand.</start_turn
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	When the hand bones are dislocated, the reduction of the dislocation is light; on the contrary to other joints, however, care must be taken in the reduction of the dislocation in the time that it is dislocated, since it may cause damage to the bone or that there is a fracture in it.</start_turn
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocation is that you place the hand of the patient on a table and extend the limb, and the doctor places his hand or palm on the imminent part of the joint, and gently press inwards until it returns to its original position.</start_turn
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it must be considered if the palm is already bent inwards of the hand, then the patient should support two fingers of his hand on a table beside the extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is preexistent, you should support two fingers of the hand, since the hand of the doctor should be placed over that imminent part of the joint.</start_turn
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And so if it returns well, it is good; and if not, then press that part with a plaster while giving up the fracture and leaving it; do not repeat this treatment until several days have passed.</start_turn
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint must remain according to its flexibility; and do not notice to the patient any cause, but that the hand is softened and cannot withstand any cause; for it is understood that the nerves are cut or crushed, and that it is not strained in it except for the pressure of the treatment and the force that is given to it.</start_turn
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore when the limb is returned, then pause over it the plaster that has been recommended, and leave it and stretch it for five days; and then it should be dissected and left loose, and the hand should be exercised.</start_turn
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	And if there is still stiffness in it and any gravity occurs in it, then you should moisten that part with warm water and perform several compresses until it is relieved.</start_turn
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.</start_turn
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the care of dislocation of the fingers.</start_turn
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some fingers are dislocated throughout.</start_turn
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when one of those fingers is dislocated at the base of the palm or at the root of the finger, then you should hold the finger still and gently press the dislocation back into place.</start_turn
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And support the tip of the finger, suspend that beyond the part where it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.</start_turn
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And so suspend it and extend it until it returns to its original position.</start_turn
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	When night comes, lie down as that story tells you, and do not cease to unbind that one in the day and exercise with movement, and lie down at night; and do this for several days until it is healed.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same as before, if it is dislocated under the thumb, and lie down until that part is healed and do the first operation again, until it is healed.</end_of_turn>
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And do the same as before, if it is dislocated in other parts.</end_of_turn>
Capitol .xxx.	End of document.</end_of_turn>
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the bones of the knee.</end_of_turn
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When an accident happens to any of the bones of the knee or the ankle is dislocated completely, and so remain loose the bones of the limb, in that case there is no treatment, for death covers the patient.</end_of_turn
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of this is that the evacuation of the patient is outside their will, and cannot be retained; and many times it is recommended to soften the limb by means of its veins or two incisions of its flesh, or one of these; or that one bone be broken, for in that case many times the bone must be broken and many times it must be broken for the evacuation to take place.</end_of_turn
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore that one is already broken at the back and is called gelboil.</end_of_turn
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	The treatment of these is that you consider if the gelboil comes from infancy, for in that case neither treatment nor healing is of any use.</end_of_turn
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	More often we see in cases of accident or percussion or even by suspicion that the Ancients speak of various methods of treatment, of which the most profitable return to profit; however, I already mentioned that little is known of most of them because of their excessive number, for my proximity to the understanding of their exposure, to which I have already alluded and from which I have learned much.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	I say that in gelboil that comes from the front of the foot, neither bandage nor healing is of that; and in the same way as for two fractures.</end_of_turn
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	The only one that is cured of these is that which happens in the two bones themselves as I recommend.</end_of_turn
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And let the patient be placed with his face downwards on a soft cushion of cloth, and extend from him the limb as much as possible so that it does not touch the bones of the foot.</end_of_turn
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And place another support under the knee, fixed to the ground at the top of the limb, and another support outside the foot at the bottom of the limb.</end_of_turn
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	The minister has the support, and does not hold it fixed in the fossa; and another minister has the other in the same way.</end_of_turn
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And cover the head of the patient with a bandage and leave the toes uncovered; extend the limb from the thigh to the foot support and hold it there; and do the same with the other limb from the hip to the foot.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And the ministers extend the limb to the support, and do not break both supports and the ligaments of the limbs in which they are placed, although indeed we have said this.</end_of_turn
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his palms on the bone with force until it returns, or that he places them on a table, and that he adjusts under the table the feet of the patient until they return.</end_of_turn
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	If it does not return in this way, take a table whose breadth or length is three palms, and make a hole in the wall where we have said that it is proper for the patient to be placed a limb in which the limb of the table is inserted.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the heel of the table on the bone, the doctor places the feet of the patient on the other side, and gently pull until the bone is fractured and returns to its place.</end_of_turn>
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, or turn it around with the hand; and stay on the ground with the head of the patient behind the knee of the two supports, the length of which is an arm, and place the head of the limb behind the knee of the limb outwards two supports; and the length is as much as between any two supports a palm, and there is already a break in any support in which the return is made, and that nothing is fixed on the ground so that it is not crushed.</end_of_turn
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	The joint pain is caused by cold humors that spread throughout the body, and when it affects the feet, doctors commonly call it gout.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of the limb is a joint in which the foot is formed, its length being equal to one palm from heel to toe; and in the two other thighs it is similar to this.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And now strengthen the ligaments that you have stretched in the patient's feet at the joint that is opposite their head, and the ligaments that you have stretched in the space between their thighs at the joint that is opposite their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And now you must finish with each joint and appoint a minister who will support the joint with his hand, and the doctor will grasp the vertebra according to what has been said
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	This is the manner of the joint
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	Once the vertebra has been returned, and the limb has been grasped, then immediately place over the excision some ointment made from alum and vinegar, and cover it; and place over the ointment a bandage about three fingers wide or somewhat more, and the length of the bandage should be equal to the height of the swelling, and place it over the part of the vertebra that is below the head of the joint.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And so keep it bound with the ligament that we have mentioned, and use the patient a nourishing diet until they are healed
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any swelling remains in the limb at the end of the healing process, then it is necessary to administer medicines that soften and soothe the swelling, with the administration of alum; this has been recommended; and it is administered in that limb of lead lamina of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	In every case where there is suspicion of imminent dislocation of the bones of the two thighs, it is cured by that dislocation; and that is the bone which has already been mentioned as being in imminent danger of causing death if it should suffer further injury from this medicine.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXII
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the thigh and the joint of the muscle do not suffer only from dislocation, but also from other affections that affect the other joints of the limb distant from the head and with concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the hip joint is dislocated in four ways, that is, to the back, to the front, to the upper part, or to the lower part
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	Mostly it is dislocated at the back, and rarely at the front or at the sides
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	A sign of dislocation at the back is that, when you adjust the limb of the healthy patient against the limb of the patient, the nail is longer and more prominent than in the healthy limb, the limb cannot bend its knee over the ankle, and the limb is limp from the knee downwards after a traumatic fall, because the head of the bone has already been fractured here
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the dislocation at the front is that the injuries to it are contrary to this one.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of dislocation at the upper part is that the limb expands slightly following the wound, however it does not bend where it is painful; and if you force it to bend there, it cannot go beyond that point; and the urine is retained and the feces are delayed, and you must walk the patient on the tiptoes
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of dislocation at the lower part is that it does not expand the limb, nor does it permit bending of that knee which bends the feces, the limb is shorter than the other, the feces are softened, and the head of the bone is below that point
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	More reduction of these species of dislocation is that you consider, in fact, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it is already antiquated, and that you must not do anything about it; for in such a case it is not necessary to do so.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	More in the case where the dislocation is recent, and is one of the four species of dislocation, then you must support the joint and extend it to the back and front, and also to the right and left, for that is what will cause it to return and will not require any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	More so, if it does not return in this way, then you must prepare strong ministers and extend the limb beyond the knee, or beyond the ankle, or over the ligament which is stretched over the limb; and another minister should grasp the hand of that side that holds the ankles and press with his thumbs the area of the limb; and strengthen with a grip the ligament over the hip, and have another minister hold the limb of the patient.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery. And reduce the swelling or abscess to its concavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the abscess from bursting.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And extend all of them [the limbs] in a straight line until the patient is elevated above the ground and remains suspended
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this method of extension is common to all four [limbs].
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And thus, if the dislocation returns to what has been said, it is good; but if not, it is necessary to apply some means of treatment as we have said before
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of it [the dislocation] itself, when it is dislocated, if the dislocation is to the front, cover that the patient is resuscitated over the buttock; and place your hand over the ligament at the root of the thigh in that place where between the head of the thigh and the place that remains to be extended.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister should firmly press the patient's flanks, and measure the great toe of the painful thigh and extend it outwards by violent extension, so that that which returned to the proper place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this is the lightest treatment of the member that has been reduced compared to the other treatments<end_turn>
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	If it is excused from you and you do not obey the order concerning this treatment, then cover that both feet of the patient are firmly bound with strong ligatures, with care on both ankles and both knees.<end_turn>
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each part is four fingers, and the painful limb is extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the patient should be suspended over the head of the bed, and that is in the greatest amount; and the length of the limb from the ground is the quantity of two thighs.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And order a strong boy to press the head of the thigh, and that it be suspended with the patient; and the other boy will press the thigh with force, so that the joint returns to its proper place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	And in the reduction itself, when the dislocation is to the front, cover that the patient grasps about the heel according to what we have recommended in the former part; and tighten the ligament over the painful limb properly and over the foot of the limb.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two cushions are placed, one under the foot, and the other under the head; and cushions are placed adjusted to the middle of the limb that is resting on which a damp cloth is wrapped, so that the patient is not wet because the cushion is between the patient's thighs, because from that the extension of the limbs outwards should not be violent.<end_turn>
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And every minister extends their part, and the doctor with their hand grasps the reduction according to the art.<end_turn><end_turn>
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey respectfully, it will be very good; but if not, stop diligently and as we have said in the instructions for that treatment.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But cover that the patient grasps about the buttock somewhat.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is to the front, cover that the limb is extended with care, as it is said above; and the doctor places the palm of their right hand over the painful area, and the other hand will compress that which is towards the other foot, and in that compression pause that which is extended outwards from the knee
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is to the back, cover that the patient is not extended outwards, but is elevated above the ground; having covered that it should be held firmly, even if the ankle is dislocated outwards, as we have said concerning the position of the limb; and it is on its face and the ligaments are extended, as we have said, without haste
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And cover that a compress is administered to the area around the joint.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore when the reduction is accomplished as we have said — and the sign of the reduction of the limb is not hidden from you, that is that you extend two limbs of the patient, and when you once again touch those cloths and the patient stretches their limb and expands that limb, you know that the limb according to what we have said has returned — and you adjust two cushions and hold tight and stretch with a bandage so that the ankle is not bruised in any of the parts; and keep the patient still for three days or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And remove the ligament and the bandage, and compare one limb to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	When once those boils have burst in the garment, know that the dislocation has already ceased, and now let the patient depart.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if there be any cause of swelling, then return it and cover it up, and extract it according to your first structure, and leave it for three days.</end_of_turn>
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then remove that, and make the patient walk slowly for a few days, until he is comforted.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxii.	(The text continues with medical instructions and recommendations.)</end_of_turn>
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the care of dislocation of the elbow.</end_of_turn>
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The elbow is dislocated in three ways, that is, it is dislocated at the outer parts, and at the inner parts, and at the lower parts towards the upper parts; but it is not dislocated at the front parts.</end_of_turn
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is that the patient applies his hand to the thigh; know that the elbow is dislocated.</end_of_turn
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these ways is that you make the patient move his limb, and if you can do this over what is necessary; bind his thigh to his face, and place his foot between his thighs; and in addition bind the elbow to his palms, and keep those between his thighs over the elbow.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of recovery is that his limb adheres to his thigh without laborious movement.</end_of_turn
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then cover that up and bind the limb to his thigh, and tie those together with a bandage for three days or four, and then remove those.</end_of_turn
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not let the patient walk for several days, until he is healthy and comfortable.</end_of_turn
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	Moreover, if the dislocation has been reduced by you, know that it is excusable to administer strong extension to the ligaments from which it was preceded in the treatment of the hip.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxiii.	(The text continues with additional medical instructions and recommendations.)</end_of_turn
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the care of dislocation of the ankle.</end_of_turn
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle has some veins that are easily ligated for slight displacement, and some veins are dislocated according to custom, and the dislocation is caused either by the front parts or the back parts.</end_of_turn
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	The sign of dislocation is that sometimes the ankle swells up proceeding from the part to which it is dislocated.</end_of_turn
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	More importantly, the treatment for its displacement is of little reduction, that is, that it is easily extended with the toes flexed and is swollen up until it returns.</end_of_turn
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	More importantly, in the treatment of dislocation according to custom, make the patient move his limb, and keep that part firmly in place with a strong and valiant minister from the back of the two of those in the middle of his limb.</end_of_turn
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And put your right hand on the great toe, and your left hand on the lower part of the foot in the place of the ankle.</end_of_turn
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and with your left hand for two veins, and extend with your left; and support the foot of the limb with your right hand beside the bandage work.</end_of_turn
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Do as we have said above two veins.</end_of_turn
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And support the foot of the limb with the bandage for the third vein, and you are at the ankle.</end_of_turn
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if it returns in one vein or two according to this method, and if sometimes the foot is swollen up, that is good; but if not, know that you must repeat the operation until it returns.</end_of_turn>
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	More importantly, if it is prohibited to reduce it in this way, make the patient walk on his toes over the earth, and loosen a bandage on the earth, and put a cushion between his thighs, and you have already bound him over his limb for so that he does not bruise the patient.</end_of_turn
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And the minister of the limb has his thighs, and another minister extends the foot with his toes or with ligaments that lie over the ankle of the foot; and extend the other as much as possible against the extension of the knee, and the cushion is to exist between the patient's thighs to retain that.</end_of_turn
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	The doctor grasps the dislocation at the knee, while another attendant holds the healthy limb away from the area where the dislocation has occurred, allowing it to return easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	Therefore, when the dislocation has returned and you have declared that the reduction is successful, then remove the plaster and gently stretch the limb, tying it firmly to the limb and the bandage.</end_of_turn>
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware that you fear or guard the nerves that lie behind the heel, so that the ligament above does not become taut and that the limb does not become deformed.</end_of_turn
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then keep the limb still for two days or three; and if the ligament has softened, remove it.</end_of_turn>
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And on the fourth day or the fifth, remove the dressing and prohibit the patient from bending for forty days.</end_of_turn>
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	Even if it is necessary to go up and down that space, it is not harmful for safety that the dislocation is not dissolved or deformed, and that you do not neglect the treatment.</end_of_turn>
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if by any chance the patient has a relapse, cover that you administer in the cessation of the aforementioned narration, in another place of care and treatment, until it has healed.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XLI.</end_of_turn>
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocations of the toes.</end_of_turn
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Therefore, that which is dislocated must be grasped with little traction, and what is not difficult, abstain from it.</end_of_turn
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	And if the dislocation is in the ankle bone of the two feet, then cover that you make the patient sit on the ground or on a table, and that he stays like that as if he were going.</end_of_turn
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And keep your feet still, and place the limb over what you anticipate of the joints, and support that limb with the hand until it returns, and that you see that it has healed and does not reappear in the immediate area.</end_of_turn
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And place under the foot of the limb a board that covers the whole foot, which has two caps, and support that limb with the hand so that it is stretched downwards and firm for three days; and then remove it and have the patient walk again for a month, until it is healed and the pain is gone.</end_of_turn
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XLV.</end_of_turn
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the species of dislocations that are caused by swelling or fracture or any other injury.</end>
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of these causes occur, and you take care of the treatment and restoration of it, many people succeed in overcoming death.</end>
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for this, do not presume that you can provide care for it alone, but rather that one who is skilled in the art, with long experience, mercy and humility, should be taken into account; and let him use medicines at the beginning that do not cause relapse so soon, and let the patient be subject to divine judgment, rather than to that which you hope will bring health, except for the relief of the disease and the hope of salvation.</end>
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore do your utmost to reduce it at the beginning of the disease, before relapse occurs.</end>
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And if the limb returns as it should, then administer a regimen that does not cause relapse, and care for the swelling with the remedies that are appropriate for it.</end
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is in a fractured bone of the heel separated by a space, then you break the ligament of that, and do as we have said in the simple diseases of the joints above.</end
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	Beware and take precautions as you are able, according to your prudence, of that which precedes this, as I have foretold; for what is better for you than the Creator Himself, and more lasting to your glory, and more profitable in the end than all the rest.</end>
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the discourse of Albucasim perfectly well, of which God be praised.</end
Amen.	Amen.</start_of_turn>
